enhanced_info.title: H/F Senior Specialist Web Technology
enhanced_info.description:
French Version below***


We are hiring a Senior Specialist Web Technology to join our team in Ireland, the UK or Saint-Priest (France). 


Let’s talk about the role:


As a Senior Specialist Web Technology, you will lead the development and implementation of our web infrastructure & digital asset strategy. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in web development, with expertise in SEO, analytics, responsive designs & digital health optimization. You will be responsible for overseeing cross-functional teams, driving website launches, and optimizing the web eco-system to meet digital marketing needs and achieve business objectives.

Let’s talk about responsibilities:


Drive and support digital transformation initiatives – Lead projects such as the rollout of new platforms or pilot programs, in alignment with global or local strategies.Collaborate on product launch campaigns – Partner with global marketing teams to develop and execute launch plans as they pertain to web technology.Track and assess effectiveness of web technologies – Coordinate the setup for monitoring and analysis of digital campaigns and initiatives through a successful connection with Datadog and Analytics suite and implement corrective actions where necessary.Improve digital infrastructure – Work closely with the Global Technology Solutions to evolve and optimize digital infrastructure across markets.Bridge technical and business communication – Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and development teams, translating business needs into actionable technical requirements.Structure and optimize data frameworks – Understand how data models relate to CMS platforms and ensure alignment with data pipelines and analytical reporting needs.Ensure analytics readiness – Support the structuring of datalayers for optimal integration with CMS and analytics platforms such as Google Analytics.Leverage APIs and data standards – Apply knowledge of API usage and JSON-formatted data to support data exchange and integration between platforms.Embed project governance – Lead project planning and execution with best-in-class tools like Asana and Jira, ensuring timely and efficient delivery.Think strategically – Bring a strategic and solution-oriented mindset to technical challenges, supporting innovation and continuous improvement.Support digital infrastructure health – Maintain awareness and operational knowledge of core technical tools and services including Web Application Firewalls (WAF), Content Delivery Networks (CDN), and DNS configurations.Champion best practices – Promote excellence in project execution through prioritisation, proactive management, and collaboration with cross-functional international teams.


Let’s talk about qualifications and experience:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Marketing or a related field, or equivalent experience.5+ years of experience in a similar role with demonstrated success in managing digital initiatives. Proficiency with CMS tools like WordPress, HubSpot, ContentStack. Strong analytical mindset with the ability to understand data models and their relationship to CMS systems and data pipelines.Solid understanding of data layers and how they are structured to enable CMS platforms to effectively capture analytics data (e.g., Google Analytics).Proficient in working with APIs and interpreting JSON-structured data.Ability to act as a bridge between business and technical teams by understanding the language of developers and translating business needs into technical requirements.Proven project management experience, with the ability to manage multiple concurrent initiatives and prioritize effectively.Hands-on experience with project management tools such as Asana and Jira.Strategic thinker with the capacity to contribute to technical problem-solving and digital strategy planning.Familiarity with key digital infrastructure components such as Web Application Firewalls (WAF), Content Delivery Networks (CDN), and Domain Name Systems (DNS). Experience with PostMan to test data connections and payload transfers. High level of rigor, attention to detail, and organizational skills.Proactive, energetic, and enthusiastic, with the ability to take initiative in a fast-paced environment.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Comfortable working in an international environment and collaborating with diverse stakeholders (both internal and external).Strong interpersonal skills and experience in cross-functional teamwork.High regard for confidentiality, with a strong sense of autonomy and responsibility.


Let’s talk about your skills:


Solid knowledge of Office tools and new digital techniques (CMS, web marketing, etc.).Solid knowledge of visualization tools like Miro or Draw.io.Previous history working closely with developers is a plus.Fluent in English (written and spoken).Proficiency in an additional language, ideally French and/or German, is a plus.Proven experience managing multiple projects.SEO skills would be an asset.


Additional information:


At Resmed, all employees benefit from a bonus plan, the percentage of which depends on your position within the organisation.Working from home flexibilityYou also have access to a referral bonus and to ResMed's preferred shareholding programmeCompetitive benefits (Pension, Long-Term Illness Protection, Health Insurance...)Internal career opportunity - joining an international fast-pace and massively growing company


OK, so what's next?


Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now

Version Française***


Nous recrutons un(e) H/F Senior Specialist Web Technology pour nous rejoindre sur notre site de Saint-Priest.


Parlons du poste:


En tant que H/F Senior Specialist Web Technology, vous serez responsable de la direction du développement et de la mise en œuvre de notre infrastructure web et de notre stratégie en matière d’actifs numériques. Le/la candidat(e) idéal(e) possédera une solide expérience en développement web, avec une expertise en SEO, en analytique, en "Responsive design" et en optimisation de la santé numérique. Vous superviserez des équipes interfonctionnelles, piloterez les lancements de sites web et optimiserez l’écosystème digital pour répondre aux besoins du marketing numérique et atteindre les objectifs commerciaux.

Parlons des responsabilités : 


Piloter et soutenir les initiatives de transformation digitale – Diriger des projets tels que le déploiement de nouvelles plateformes ou de programmes pilotes, en cohérence avec les stratégies globales ou locales.Collaborer aux campagnes de lancement de produits – Travailler avec les équipes marketing mondiales pour développer et exécuter les plans de lancement liés aux technologies web.Suivre et évaluer l’efficacité des technologies web – Coordonner la mise en place du suivi et de l’analyse des campagnes digitales via Datadog et la suite Analytics, et mettre en œuvre des actions correctives si nécessaire.Améliorer l’infrastructure digitale – Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes Global Technology Solutions pour faire évoluer et optimiser l’infrastructure digitale à travers les marchés.Faire le lien entre technique et métier – Servir d’intermédiaire entre les parties prenantes métier et les équipes de développement, en traduisant les besoins business en exigences techniques concrètes.Structurer et optimiser les cadres de données – Comprendre les modèles de données liés aux CMS et assurer leur alignement avec les pipelines de données et les besoins en reporting analytique.Garantir la préparation analytique – Soutenir la structuration des datalayers pour une intégration optimale avec les CMS et les plateformes d’analyse telles que Google Analytics.Exploiter les API et les standards de données – Utiliser les API et les données au format JSON pour faciliter l’échange et l’intégration entre les plateformes.Intégrer la gouvernance projet – Diriger la planification et l’exécution des projets avec des outils de référence comme Asana et Jira, en garantissant une livraison efficace et dans les délais.Penser stratégiquement – Apporter une vision stratégique et orientée solution aux défis techniques, en soutenant l’innovation et l’amélioration continue.Assurer la santé de l’infrastructure digitale – Maintenir une connaissance opérationnelle des outils techniques clés tels que les pare-feux applicatifs web (WAF), les réseaux de diffusion de contenu (CDN) et les configurations DNS.Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques – Encourager l’excellence dans l’exécution des projets via la priorisation, la gestion proactive et la collaboration avec des équipes internationales interfonctionnelles.


Parlons des qualifications et de l'expérience:


Diplôme en informatique, marketing ou domaine connexe, ou expérience équivalente.Minimum 5 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire avec des réussites démontrées dans la gestion d’initiatives digitales.Maîtrise des outils CMS tels que WordPress, HubSpot, ContentStack.Esprit analytique avec capacité à comprendre les modèles de données et leur relation avec les systèmes CMS et les pipelines de données.Bonne compréhension des datalayers et de leur structuration pour permettre aux CMS de capturer efficacement les données analytiques (ex. : Google Analytics).Compétence dans l’utilisation des API et l’interprétation des données structurées en JSON.Capacité à faire le lien entre les équipes métier et techniques en traduisant les besoins business en exigences techniques.Expérience avérée en gestion de projet, avec capacité à gérer plusieurs initiatives simultanées et à prioriser efficacement.Maîtrise des outils de gestion de projet tels qu’Asana et Jira.Esprit stratégique avec capacité à contribuer à la résolution de problèmes techniques et à la planification de la stratégie digitale.Familiarité avec les composants clés de l’infrastructure digitale tels que les WAF, CDN et DNS.Expérience avec PostMan pour tester les connexions de données et les transferts de payload.Rigueur, sens du détail et excellentes compétences organisationnelles.Proactivité, dynamisme et enthousiasme, avec capacité à prendre des initiatives dans un environnement rapide.Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et orale.À l’aise dans un environnement international et en collaboration avec des parties prenantes variées (internes et externes).Solides compétences interpersonnelles et expérience du travail en équipe interfonctionnelle.Sens élevé de la confidentialité, autonomie et responsabilité.


Parlons de vos compétences : 


Bonne maîtrise des outils Office et des nouvelles techniques digitales (CMS, web marketing, etc.).Bonne maîtrise des outils de visualisation comme Miro ou Draw.io.Expérience antérieure en collaboration étroite avec des développeurs est un plus.Maîtrise de l’anglais (écrit et oral).Maîtrise d’une langue supplémentaire, idéalement le français et/ou l’allemand, est un plus.Expérience confirmée dans la gestion de projets multiples.Compétences en SEO seraient un atout.


Autres avantages et informations:


Proche des transports en commun – Arrêt T2 Parc Technologique de Saint Priest & Parking sur placeChez ResMed, tous les employés bénéficient d’un plan de bonus dont le pourcentage dépend de votre emploi au sein de l’organisation.Vous avez également accès à une prime de cooptation et au programme d’actionnariat privilégié de ResMed.Vous bénéficierez aussi de l’intéressement et de la participation aux conditions fixées par nos accords internesEnfin, tickets restaurants, salle de repas sur place, mutuelle, remboursement de la moitié des transports en commun et activités du CE font également parti de vos avantages.Nous offrons des possibilités d’évolution en interne.


OK, quelle est la prochaine étape? 


Rejoindre ResMed, signifie bien plus que dire "oui" à l'idée de faire du monde un endroit plus sain. C'est découvrir une carrière pleine de défis, de soutien et d'inspiration. Une culture axée sur l'excellence qui vous aide non seulement à atteindre vos objectifs, mais aussi à en créer de nouveaux. Nous nous attachons à créer une culture diversifiée et inclusive, à encourager l'expression individuelle sur le lieu de travail et à prospérer grâce aux idées novatrices qui en découlent. Si ce lieu de travail vous convient, postulez dès maintenant !

Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!

enhanced_info.title: Web Optimization & SEO Specialist
enhanced_info.description:
Job Highlights:Contract: Independent ContractorSchedule: Between 9:00 am to 4:00 pm, Ambler, PA, USA, Eastern Time
Job Overview:We are looking for a part-time virtual assistant to help modernize and maintain our existing website. This role will initially require monthly updates to keep our site fresh, functional, and aligned with industry trends. After an initial period, the update frequency will shift to a quarterly schedule while still ensuring our website remains visually appealing and optimized for performance.
Responsibilities:Website Modernization: Implement updates to enhance the look, feel, and user experience of our site, including layout improvements, updated visuals, and mobile responsiveness.Content Updates: Modify website content as needed to reflect the latest company offerings, partnerships, and industry trends.SEO Optimization: Perform quarterly SEO audits and updates to improve search rankings and ensure our website remains competitive in organic search results.Performance Monitoring: Identify and resolve technical issues affecting site speed, navigation, and overall functionality.Collaboration: Work closely with our team to ensure updates align with our branding and business objectives.
RequirementsThis is a part-time, remote position, with working hoursProficiency in website design and maintenance (WordPress, HTML, CSS, or relevant CMS platforms).Strong understanding of SEO best practices and tools like Google Analytics, SEMrush, or Yoast.Experience in UX/UI enhancements to improve visitor engagement.Detail-oriented with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.Prior experience in the parking technology or related industries is a plus but not required.
BenefitsIndependent Contractor Perks:Permanent work from homeImmediate hiringSteady freelance job
Please note that since this is a permanent work-from-home position and an “Independent Contractor” arrangement, the candidates must have their own computer and internet connection. They will handle their own benefits and taxes. The professional fees are on hourly rates and the rate depends on your performance in the application process.
ZR_26635_JOB

enhanced_info.title: Head of Performance Marketing
enhanced_info.description:
About Eneba
At Eneba, we’re building an open, safe and sustainable marketplace for the gamers of today and tomorrow. Our marketplace supports close to 20m+ active users (and growing fast!), provides a level of trust, safety and market accessibility unparalleled to none. We’re proud of what we’ve accomplished in such a short time and look forward to sharing this journey with you. Join us as we continue to scale, diversify our portfolio, and grow with the evolving community of gamers.
About the Role
We’re hiring a Head of Performance Marketing to lead our user acquisition efforts and help drive Eneba’s next stage of growth. Today, performance marketing is managed by several teams reporting directly to the co-founder. You’ll step in to lead, organize, and scale these teams—starting with influencer marketing and Google Ads, with the potential to expand your scope over time. This is a hands-on and strategic role where you’ll drive meaningful growth through paid media and influencer partnerships, combining data-driven optimization with creative marketing tactics. You’ll be managing significant marketing budgets and helping Eneba scale its reach in a competitive, fast-growing gaming marketplace.
About the Team
You’ll report directly our Co-founder and CMO and work closely with:
- Influencer Marketing and Paid Media teams (initially direct reports)- SEO, Affiliates, Social Media, and Content teams (collaborative partners, possible future reports)- Data & Analytics teams (for real-time performance tracking and experimentation)
Responsibilities
Own and lead Eneba’s influencer strategy and paid media performance across key global markets.Manage large-scale marketing budgets efficiently, optimizing for spend vs. payback ratios.Scale the influencer marketing function, both strategically and operationally, across YouTube, Twitch, TikTok, and other platforms.Lead and develop the Paid Search team (Google Ads), driving efficient user acquisition at scale.Drive a data-led, experimental growth approach, constantly iterating on campaigns and creative tactics.Partner cross-functionally with Product, Analytics, Creative, and Content teams to align marketing and business goals.Develop creative, hackish strategies tailored to a low LTV product, optimizing across acquisition channels.Mentor and grow a high-performing marketing team, eventually expanding your leadership scope.
Must-have Requirements
Experience in B2C (eCommerce, D2C, SaaS) companies managing significant paid media budgets and driving strong year-over-year growth.Strong influencer marketing leadership experience (minimum 2+ years), managing large budgets and long-term partnerships.Good understanding of Google Ads performance optimization, even if not hands-on daily.Proven people manager, leading and motivating multi-functional teams.Highly data-driven, with a creative growth mindset and a track record of building scalable user acquisition strategies.Comfortable working in fast-growth, high-pressure environments; self-driven and hungry to prove success.
Nice-to-have Requirements
Experience with affiliate marketing, SEO, PR, and social media growth tactics.Exposure to international growth, ideally in English-speaking markets like the US, UK, or Australia.Hands-on experience working with low LTV digital goods or gaming marketplaces.
What's in it for you?
Full ownership of performance marketing in a high-budget environment, with the autonomy to shape teams and strategy.The opportunity to scale one of Europe’s top gaming marketplaces and drive millions in revenue growth.Work across multiple products (digital goods marketplace and play-to-earn projects).A dynamic and fast-paced growth culture where your leadership makes an immediate impact.
What it’s like to work at Eneba
*Opportunity to join our Employee Stock Options program.*Opportunity to help scale a unique product.*Various bonus systems: performance-based, referral, additional paid leave, personal learning budget.*Paid volunteering opportunities.*Work location of your choice: office, remote, opportunity to work and travel.*Personal and professional growth at an exponential rate supported by well-defined feedback and promotion processes.
*Please attach CV's in English.*To find out about how we handle your personal data, make sure to check out our Candidate Privacy Notice https://www.eneba.com/candidate-privacy-notice

description.text:
About Eneba
At Eneba, we’re building an open, safe and sustainable marketplace for the gamers of today and tomorrow. Our marketplace supports close to 20m+ active users (and growing fast!), provides a level of trust, safety and market accessibility unparalleled to none. We’re proud of what we’ve accomplished in such a short time and look forward to sharing this journey with you. Join us as we continue to scale, diversify our portfolio, and grow with the evolving community of gamers.
About the Role
We’re hiring a Head of Performance Marketing to lead our user acquisition efforts and help drive Eneba’s next stage of growth. Today, performance marketing is managed by several teams reporting directly to the co-founder. You’ll step in to lead, organize, and scale these teams—starting with influencer marketing and Google Ads, with the potential to expand your scope over time. This is a hands-on and strategic role where you’ll drive meaningful growth through paid media and influencer partnerships, combining data-driven optimization with creative marketing tactics. You’ll be managing significant marketing budgets and helping Eneba scale its reach in a competitive, fast-growing gaming marketplace.
About the Team
You’ll report directly our Co-founder and CMO and work closely with:
- Influencer Marketing and Paid Media teams (initially direct reports)- SEO, Affiliates, Social Media, and Content teams (collaborative partners, possible future reports)- Data & Analytics teams (for real-time performance tracking and experimentation)
Responsibilities
Own and lead Eneba’s influencer strategy and paid media performance across key global markets.Manage large-scale marketing budgets efficiently, optimizing for spend vs. payback ratios.Scale the influencer marketing function, both strategically and operationally, across YouTube, Twitch, TikTok, and other platforms.Lead and develop the Paid Search team (Google Ads), driving efficient user acquisition at scale.Drive a data-led, experimental growth approach, constantly iterating on campaigns and creative tactics.Partner cross-functionally with Product, Analytics, Creative, and Content teams to align marketing and business goals.Develop creative, hackish strategies tailored to a low LTV product, optimizing across acquisition channels.Mentor and grow a high-performing marketing team, eventually expanding your leadership scope.
Must-have Requirements
Experience in B2C (eCommerce, D2C, SaaS) companies managing significant paid media budgets and driving strong year-over-year growth.Strong influencer marketing leadership experience (minimum 2+ years), managing large budgets and long-term partnerships.Good understanding of Google Ads performance optimization, even if not hands-on daily.Proven people manager, leading and motivating multi-functional teams.Highly data-driven, with a creative growth mindset and a track record of building scalable user acquisition strategies.Comfortable working in fast-growth, high-pressure environments; self-driven and hungry to prove success.
Nice-to-have Requirements
Experience with affiliate marketing, SEO, PR, and social media growth tactics.Exposure to international growth, ideally in English-speaking markets like the US, UK, or Australia.Hands-on experience working with low LTV digital goods or gaming marketplaces.
What's in it for you?
Full ownership of performance marketing in a high-budget environment, with the autonomy to shape teams and strategy.The opportunity to scale one of Europe’s top gaming marketplaces and drive millions in revenue growth.Work across multiple products (digital goods marketplace and play-to-earn projects).A dynamic and fast-paced growth culture where your leadership makes an immediate impact.
What it’s like to work at Eneba
*Opportunity to join our Employee Stock Options program.*Opportunity to help scale a unique product.*Various bonus systems: performance-based, referral, additional paid leave, personal learning budget.*Paid volunteering opportunities.*Work location of your choice: office, remote, opportunity to work and travel.*Personal and professional growth at an exponential rate supported by well-defined feedback and promotion processes.
*Please attach CV's in English.*To find out about how we handle your personal data, make sure to check out our Candidate Privacy Notice https://www.eneba.com/candidate-privacy-notice

enhanced_info.title: Account Manager [Opening soon]
enhanced_info.description:
Botify’s leading agentic AI search technology and seasoned experts ensure every brand has the power to be found, both in traditional and AI search. With one powerful platform, brands achieve visibility, relevance, and greater control across Google, Bing, ChatGPT, Perplexity, and more.

Botify’s technology powers agentic workflows, AI-driven recommendations, and automated cross-platform indexation and deployment. Brands maximize visibility wherever consumers, bots, and AI agents search, protecting and capturing revenue across all search platforms.

Trusted by 500+ leading brands including Macy’s, Levi’s, Farfetch, the New York Times, and Marks & Spencer, Botify drives digital discovery, sustained profitability, productivity, and brand authority in an AI-first world.

Industry research shows that women and those in traditionally underrepresented groups generally don't apply to jobs unless they check all the boxes for the role. If you feel strongly that you have what it takes for this role but don't check 100% of the boxes - that's okay - we encourage you to apply anyway and highlight what you can bring to the table!

We are looking for a customer-obsessed, commercially-minded professional to join our growing Account Management team. As an Account Manager, you’ll be responsible for growing and maintaining our existing revenue base with many of the world’s most exciting global brands. You’ll have a dedicated book of business among our enterprise accounts, and it will be up to you to own the commercial partnership between Botify and those customers. You’ll be passionate about helping customers to realise value from their technology investments, and will earn credibility by becoming adept at articulating and showing the core capabilities of Botify’s solution.

Role Overview

Your Responsibilities

Build strong relationships with key decision-makers in Marketing/SEO departments across enterprise companiesBe a voice for the customer within Botify, driving a customer-centric approach to all engagements Botify has with the customer.Know your client organisations inside and out - key players, reporting structure, budget cycles, growth goals, strategic initiatives.Work closely on a team with our Program Managers and SEO Strategy Managers to ensure customers are seeing maximum value from the partnership.Develop a deep understanding of Botify’s value proposition, customer use cases, market positioning, and product featuresOwn the entire renewal process: running discovery to understand the critical KPIs, evaluation criteria, and decision process; confirming budget; and shepherding the contract over the finish line.Close product expansions, upsells, and cross-sells to grow your book of business and help deliver best-in-class net revenue growth.Lead quarterly business reviews, owning a value-based commercial narrative and business outcome.

Your Qualification

5+ years of relevant experience in the SEO or broader digital technology space, with demonstrated success in demanding, fast-paced environments.A proven track record of success achieving new business and revenue growth metricsExperience demonstrating and selling complex enterprise solutionsAuthentically passionate about helping our customers to grow their businesses and hit their targets.Empathetic and persuasive, with a strong mix of emotional intelligence and business savvy.Goal-driven, with capabilities of identifying clear paths to positive outcomes in complex scenarios.Highly detail-oriented and able to keep numerous balls in the air at once without skipping a beat; you can project manage and set priorities while managing multiple client relationships.An ability to establish strong, trusting relationships with key decision makers at all levelsDependable, honest, and trustworthy in your communication both internally and externally.Ambitious; energised by being part of a high-performing, world-class team.

What We Offer

To keep our employees happy and motivated, we are always assessing the benefits/perks we offer to ensure we are competitive. Here are some we’d like to highlight:

Location: brand new offices in the center of Paris (12 rue d’Amsterdam, straight out of Gare Saint-Lazare)Hybrid remote policyAttractive Remuneration Package with BSPCE (for Permanent full-time role - CDI)Fun office culture & regular outings such as Team Off-Sites, Annual Kick-Off, Quaterly Team Lunch, Thirsty Thursdays etc. Lunch vouchers, 50% of transportation reimbursement, fitness classes, generous CSE advantages etc. Compelling growth perspectives Start date: as soon as possible

In addition to the skills and experience we are looking for, our ideal candidate would embody our core values:

Empower Customers. Unleash Potential.

Learn Fast. Progress Faster.

Go the Extra Mile. It’s Never Crowded.

Work Hard. Stay Humble.

Be Bold. Be You.

Botify is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

We're eager to add talent to our growing team, across departments and around the globe. Scout our open roles for your next opportunity.

enhanced_info.title: Analyste Acquisition & Growth (E-Commerce / DTC)
enhanced_info.description:
Description Du Poste

Overview :

On ne cherche pas un simple media buyer junior – on cherche le bras droit d'un des meilleurs talents Growth d'Europe. Quelqu’un capable de gérer et analyser des campagnes Meta Ads, de manipuler les données (exports, BP, P&L) avec précision, tout en étant le bras droit opérationnel du Head of Growth. On cherche un profil analytique, structuré, talentueux, qui a déjà démontré sa capacité à gérer plusieurs projets simultanément et à délivrer avec rigueur et impact.

Pourquoi rejoindre Reach :

REACH est un accélérateur e-commerce spécialisé dans l’hyper-croissance. On emmène les marques de 1M€ à 30M€+ de chiffre d’affaires par an avec un modèle 100% à la performance.

Après 8 ans d’expérience aux États-Unis et 50 millions d’euros dépensés en publicités, on a développé un playbook unique pour scaler des marques DTC.

Quelques résultats récents :

 De 100K€ à 1.9M€ par mois en 90 jours  De 10K€ à 800K€ par mois en 9 mois  De 200K€ à 600K€ en 6 mois 

Pourquoi on a besoin de toi :

REACH se développe rapidement et le volume de projets stratégiques augmente fortement (CRO, CRM, BFCM, nouveaux lancements). On cherche un Analyste Acquisition & Growth capable de soutenir le Head of Growth sur deux axes :

 Exécution & analyse paid media (Meta Ads, reporting, BP/P&L).  Organisation & suivi opérationnel (rétro-planning, coordination inter-équipes, relances clients). 

Tu travailleras en direct avec Jordan, notre Head of Growth, qui a plus de 7 ans d'expérience en e-commerce et qui est responsable des performances exceptionnelles sur toutes les marques du portefeuille. C’est l’opportunité d’être au cœur de la stratégie growth et de contribuer à la réussite des marques DTC les plus ambitieuses.

Tes missions :

 Exécuter et optimiser des campagnes Meta Ads (mises en place des campagnes, budgets, audiences, reporting).  Sortir, analyser et exploiter des exports Business Manager (CPA, ROAS, LTV, MER).  Faciliter la construction des BP & P&L marketing pour le compte du Head of Growth.  Prendre ownership absolu des rétro-plannings pour les projets (CRO, CRM, campagnes spéciales).  Sourcer, booker, et coordonner nos agences partenaires (CRO, CRM, etc.) et suivre leurs livrables.  Récupérer et intégrer les inputs clients (P&L, assets, informations clés) dans le temps impartis.  Assurer la coordination avec les pôles internes (CRM, data, ops, créa) pour livrer à temps. 

Profil recherché :

 1 à 3 ans d’expérience en acquisition digitale (Meta Ads) en agence ou chez l'annonceur.  Solide maîtrise de Google Sheets/Excel (index, pivot, lookups, modélisation simple).  Ultra-organisé, rigoureux, capable de suivre plusieurs projets en parallèle.  Excellente communication, français impeccable, anglais professionnel.  Connaissance des fondamentaux e-commerce / DTC (CAC, AOV, LTV, CR, MER). 

Rémunération :

 Fixe : 40 000 € – 50 000 € par an (selon profil).  Variable : 5 000 € – 10 000 € par an (indexé sur les résultats et la qualité d’exécution). 

La rémunération est ajustable en fonction du profil.

Ce rôle est pour toi si :

 Tu sais auditer un export Meta et proposer des actions concrètes.  Tu sais construire des BP à partir d'exports bruts et suivre les écarts réel vs prévision.  Tu es direct, transparent, no-bullshit.  Tu veux voir l’impact direct de ton travail sur la croissance des marques.  Tu incarnes la culture REACH : performance, transparence, et humain. 

Opportunités de développement :

REACH accélère fortement et ce rôle peut rapidement évoluer :

 Devenir Growth Strategist avec la gestion directe de comptes stratégiques. Manager à terme une équipe de 5+ personnes Prendre des responsabilités dans Reach Ventures (holding M&A) pour contribuer à le growth de nouvelles marques DTC (horizon 2026). 

Étapes de recrutement :

 Entretien vidéo via Workable pour avoir plus d’informations sur ton parcours et ton profil. Appel de 30 minutes avec Anne-Gaëlle (Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist) afin de valider les attentes.Appel de 1 heure avec Jordan (Head of Growth) afin de tester tes compétences techniques avec un cas pratique, et valider un fit humain. Entretien de 30 minutes avec Alessandro (CEO), pour discuter de ton background, tes ambitions et répondre à tes questions. Café avec Jordan (Head of Growth) et Alessandro (CEO) pour valider le fit final et cadrer la collaboration.

enhanced_info.title: Growth Marketing Specialist
enhanced_info.description:
At Bending Spoons, we’re striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform—which comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor’s attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That’s our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilitiesOwn. Take full ownership of your product’s marketing strategy. You’ll lead user acquisition end-to-end, from setting goals to launching campaigns and scaling what works to maximize performance.Create. Generate new ad concepts and out-of-the-box growth-hacking ideas, formulate testable hypotheses, coordinate implementation across channels like Google, Meta, and TikTok, and provide sharp feedback to continuously raise the bar.Analyze. Monitor performance through BI dashboards and campaign data. Ensure acquisition efforts achieve target KPIs, and turn insights into bold, data-driven decisions that fuel growth.Collaborate. Work closely with the product team to understand user motivations and help shape monetization and growth strategies that align with user behavior and long-term success.

What we look forReasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Drive. You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They’re challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities—just let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you’ve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.

You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You’ll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential—then, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £66,779 in the UK and €63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £110,389 and £149,636 in the UK, and €105,737 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They’re challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities—just let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you’ve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.

enhanced_info.title: Responsable communication et marketing F/H
enhanced_info.description:
L'entreprise

ESCP Business School Paris est l'école de commerce de renommée mondiale, fondée en 1819, qui forme les leaders responsables de demain. Ancrée au cœur de Paris, elle propose une pédagogie innovante et multiculturelle, s’appuyant sur un réseau de six campus européens. Reconnue pour l’excellence de ses programmes en management, elle favorise l’engagement, l’ouverture internationale et l’accompagnement personnalisé des talents tout au long de leur parcours.

Description Du Poste

Lancée en 2024 par ESCP Business School, ESCP Extension School est une structure de formation innovante et inclusive. Sa mission : accompagner les actifs – en poste, en mobilité ou en reconversion – dans leur montée en compétences, face aux grandes transformations du monde professionnel.

ESCP Extension incarne l’engagement d’ESCP Business School à démocratiser l’accès à une formation de haut niveau et à répondre aux enjeux de société, par une pédagogie résolument tournée vers l’action et l’impact.

Sous La Responsabilité De La Direction De L’Extension School, Vous Serez Chargé De Définir, Mettre En Œuvre Et Piloter La Stratégie Marketing Et Communication Afin De Renforcer La Visibilité Et L’attractivité De L’Extension School En France Et à L’international. Vos Principales Missions S'articuleront Autour De Différents Axes

Stratégie de marque et positionnement

Définir et piloter la stratégie de marque en cohérence avec les ambitions nationales et internationales de l’Extension School et de l’ESCP.Garantir la cohérence de l’identité visuelle, du ton éditorial et de la charte graphique sur l’ensemble des supports.

Communication institutionnelle et promotion

Concevoir, mettre en œuvre et coordonner des campagnes de communication (print, digital, médias).Valoriser l’Extension School auprès des cibles internes (participants, personnel, professeurs) et externes (candidats, partenaires, entreprises).Rédiger et superviser des contenus variés : communiqués de presse, newsletters, brochures, rapports annuels…Développer de nouveaux outils de communication, notamment digitaux.

Stratégie marketing

Définir et piloter la stratégie marketing en lien avec les objectifs de développement.Assurer une veille concurrentielle et sectorielle régulière.Développer, avec l’équipe commerciale, des stratégies d’acquisition et de fidélisation (SEO/SEA, emailing, social media, CRM, salons…).Optimiser la visibilité et l’e-réputation de l’école sur les plateformes digitales et éducatives.Produire et superviser les supports marketing (flyers, bannières, visuels, vidéos, etc.).Garantir la mise à jour et l’animation du site web.Suivre et analyser les indicateurs de performance (KPI, ROI, taux de conversion, trafic web).Gérer la relation avec les agences externes.

 Événementiel et relations presse

Organiser et promouvoir les événements clés : journées portes ouvertes, forums, conférences, cérémonies, masterclass…Développer et entretenir des relations avec les médias, agences et prestataires.

Coordination et management

Encadrer à terme une équipe (chargé(e) de communication, chargé(e) de marketing).Collaborer étroitement avec l’équipe Brand & Communication d’ESCP, ainsi qu’avec les directions programmes, admissions, alumni, fondation, relations entreprises et internationales.

Pilotage budgétaire

Élaborer et suivre le budget marketing et communication.Optimiser les investissements et assurer un reporting régulier.

Promotion de l’Extension School

Contribuer activement à la promotion des programmes de l’Extension School à travers des actions collectives et partenariales.

Profil recherché

Titulaire d’une formation supérieure en marketing, communication, digital ou école de commerce, vous justifiez de 5 à 8 ans d’expérience en marketing et communication, idéalement dans un contexte éducatif, institutionnel ou international.

Vous possédez d’excellentes qualités rédactionnelles et un sens affirmé de la synthèse.

Vous maîtrisez les principaux leviers du marketing digital (SEO/SEA, CRM, analytics, réseaux sociaux) et savez les mobiliser pour accroître visibilité et performance.

Votre parcours témoigne de solides compétences en gestion de projets complexes, avec une capacité à travailler en transversalité et à coordonner ou encadrer une équipe.

Créatif et force de proposition, vous alliez sens de l’innovation et rigueur budgétaire afin de concevoir et déployer des actions à la fois pertinentes et efficaces.

enhanced_info.title: French Speaking SEO Content Writer
enhanced_info.description:
RemotePermanent or Full-time ContractorCompetitive package

About Us

ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.

What Makes Us Different

At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.

Job Description

We are excited to be on the hunt for a talented and motivated individual to join our team as a French Speaking SEO Writer.

Responsibilities

Write high-quality content for our iGaming projects, primarily focused on online casinos and sports betting for the French marketCreates high-quality and engaging content, aligning with detailed briefsImplements SEO recommendations to enhance content visibilityEnsures content compliance with market trends and regulationsAdheres to the editorial calendar, meeting deadlines consistently

Qualifications

Minimum 2 years of experience in content writing or copywriting, ideally in the iGaming fieldKnowledge of French market regulations regarding online gambling (ANJ, legislation, etc.)Excellent written and spoken skills in English and FrenchPrior experience with iGaming affiliate platformsProficiency in SEO tools (such as Semrush, Ahrefs, SurferSEO, etc.)Basic HTML/CSS knowledge to improve layout in WordPressA sense of storytelling and the ability to adapt the tone to suit the target audience (informal, expert, marketing, etc.)

Benefits & Rewards

A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shineAn entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolioPersonal responsibility with a ton of autonomy33 free paid daysAn international team with over 35 nationalitiesFully Remote working Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location

What do we mean by "Fully Remote"

Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.

Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world-leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content, and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.

Diversity is a given to us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences, and cultures we bring together.

Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows

ApplyHave an introduction call with our recruitment teamDo a testHave a technical interview

Equal Opportunities

ClickOut Media is an equal-opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

enhanced_info.title: Knowledge Management Senior Specialist
enhanced_info.description:
About Remote

Remote is solving modern organizations’ biggest challenge – navigating global employment compliantly with ease. We make it possible for businesses of all sizes to recruit, pay, and manage international teams. With our core values at heart and future focused work culture, our team works tirelessly on ambitious problems, asynchronously, around the world. You can find Remoters working from 6 different continents (Antarctica left to go!) and all of our positions are fully remote.

We encourage every member of the Remote team to bring their talents, experiences and culture to the table to help us build the best-in-class HR platform.

If you are energetic, curious, motivated and ambitious, be part of our world. Apply now and define the future of work!

What This Job Can Offer You

As a Knowledge Management Specialist within the Customer Experience (CX) Operations team, you will take ownership of maintaining and evolving critical areas of the Remote knowledge base. You will play a pivotal role in improving the accuracy, accessibility, and strategic value of knowledge content that enables Remote’s teams to deliver exceptional support and compliant guidance at scale. While contributing to operational excellence today, you’ll also help shape the future of our knowledge systems by identifying opportunities for improvement, driving updates in collaboration with subject matter experts, and leveraging data to maximise impact.

You’ll work closely with product, legal, compliance, and customer-facing teams to ensure Remote’s knowledge remains a reliable, scalable source of truth across a globally distributed workforce.

What you bring

Experience: Strong operational background with experience in knowledge management, content strategy, or technical writing. Proven ability to manage structured content in a fast-paced environment.Initiative & Impact: Demonstrated ability to proactively identify automation opportunities, drive process improvements, and lead projects that align operations with product roadmaps and company values.Systems Knowledge: Familiarity with content management systems, AI-enabled knowledge tools, and CRM platforms.Collaboration Skills: Strong cross-functional collaboration experience, particularly working with Legal, Product, Ops, or Customer Support teams.Content Quality & Maintenance: Ability to ensure knowledge assets are well-written, up-to-date, and aligned with business and regulatory needs.Analytical Thinking: Comfort using data and metrics to evaluate knowledge effectiveness and identify content gaps.Initiative & Autonomy: Demonstrated ability to independently own domains and drive initiatives from planning to execution with minimal oversight.Adaptability: Thrive in dynamic, fast-changing environments where priorities shift regularly.Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication in English; ability to simplify complex ideas for broad audiences.It's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered a plus


Key Responsibilities

Knowledge Ownership: Manage and maintain assigned knowledge domains, including product guides, process documentation, and compliance-focused content.Content Creation & Maintenance: Create, revise, and optimise knowledge articles to ensure clarity, accuracy, and accessibility for global users.SSoT Alignment: Ensure documentation is treated and maintained as a Single Source of Truth (SSoT), reducing reliance on tribal knowledge or outdated material.Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with Product, Legal, Ops, and Support teams to reflect feature changes, policy updates, and operational needs within the knowledge base.Data-Informed Improvements: Use analytics to monitor article performance, identify gaps, and optimise for usability and deflection.Content Processes: Help evolve templates, workflows, and SOPs to scale knowledge management practices across teams.Knowledge Integrity: Proactively monitor legal and product change logs and contribute to update cycles that keep content current and compliant.Project Contributions: Participate in mid-scale projects related to new product launches, regional expansions, or compliance updates.Mentorship & Support: Provide guidance to junior team members and act as a connector between content creators and consumers across the organisation.


Practicals

You'll report to: Senior Director Business OperationsTeam: CX OperationsLocation: For this position we welcome everyone to apply, but we will prioritise applications from the following locations as we encourage our teams to diversify;Start date: As soon as possible


Remote Compensation Philosophy

Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

The base salary range for this full-time position is $35,350 to $99,450. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

Application process

Interview with recruiterInterview with future managerInterview with team members (no managers present)Bar Raiser Interview Prior employment verification check 


Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

work from anywhereflexible paid time offflexible working hours (we are async)16 weeks paid parental leavemental health support servicesstock optionslearning budgethome office budget & IT equipmentbudget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How You’ll Plan Your Day (and Life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How To Apply

Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

work from anywhereflexible paid time offflexible working hours (we are async)16 weeks paid parental leavemental health support servicesstock optionslearning budgethome office budget & IT equipmentbudget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How You’ll Plan Your Day (and Life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How To Apply

Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.If you don’t have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it’s important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

enhanced_info.title: Digital Marketing Director
enhanced_info.description:
Paris Office

At EF Language Abroad, we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we've helped millions of students discover new places, embrace diverse cultures, and gain fresh perspectives.

We offer immersive short-term and long-term language courses and programs across different languages in the countries where they’re spoken. Together, our global staff help students from around the world develop the language skills they need to achieve their dreams.

Are you ready for a dynamic role in a truly international environment? Are you passionate about digital marketing and strongly goal-oriented?

As the Head of Marketing you will be at the heart of our mission to connect with more learners, working in a dynamic atmosphere while shaping our digital future.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Unleash your creativityAnalyze dataDesign targeted campaigns

The everyday working language in our Paris office is French, however, this role requires excellent command of the English language as well to communicate with Global Leaders and Stakeholders. Full fluency (speaking, reading, writing) in both languages is required. Please submit your CV in English. CVs in French will not be considered. 

Your key responsibilities will include: 

You will drive a high-performing marketing team and own the marketing strategy, balancing performance marketing, brand storytelling, and offline activation to drive demand and revenue growth.

Manage a team of 10+ marketers, fostering a culture of growth, creativity, performance, and data-driven decision-makingDevelop and execute innovative digital strategies to enhance brand awareness and engage our audience in new ways.Manage paid campaigns, SEO/SEM, email marketing, and social media to turn traffic into leads and followers into brand ambassadors.Work closely with product, sales, and global marketing teams to align your vision with our objectives.Use data to measure performance, refine strategies, and exceed expectations.Ensure our content and messaging resonate with the local audience while maintaining the brand’s global identity.Oversee marketing budgets, ensuring optimal allocation of resources.Collaborate with agencies, media, and influencers to expand our reach.Stay ahead of market trends, customer feedback, and competitor actions.Organize events, webinars, and sponsorships to bring the EF brand to life.Define and execute a full-funnel marketing strategy that combines performance marketing, brand building, and offline activations to drive business growth.Own the lead generation and customer acquisition strategy, ensuring an optimal marketing mix across paid digital, organic, brand, and partnerships.

What we are looking for: 

5-10 years of experience in marketing, both digital and offlineMinimum 5 years of experience leading a teamPassionate about marketing and cutting-edge concepts in digital marketingData-driven and results-oriented – you love both spreadsheets and creative ideasA natural leader, you are comfortable in a dynamic and collaborative environmentExperienced in creating engaging campaigns and generating leadsStrong understanding of the French digital marketProven ability to lead multi-channel marketing strategies (performance, content, CRM, social, offline, and brand activations).Strong analytical mindset, able to connect marketing activities to lead generation and revenue impact.Experience in high-growth, competitive industries (e.g., travel, education, consumer services).Deep understanding of the French media landscape, including digital, influencer marketing, and traditional media.Fully fluent in French, used daily in the officeFully Fluent in English, required for global meetings

What EF offers: 

Work in the heart of Paris Opportunities to travel internationallyDiscounts on EF programs for Staff and Staff Friends and FamilyFree use of EF Hello: a premium Language Learning AppTuition Reimbursement for continued EducationBe part of a mission-driven company that transforms lives through educationTeam events, kick-offs, and Holiday Parties

At EF Language Abroad we are dedicated to our mission of opening the world through education, harnessing the power of language learning to deepen the connection between people across the globe.

Ready to open the world through education? Apply now!

About EF Education First

Openness to the world and cultural understanding are key qualities for a successful journey. Since 1965, we have helped millions of learners travel, discover new cultures, and live unique experiences.

Our immersive educational programs—focused on languages, travel, cultural exchange, and academic learning—turn dreams into international opportunities.

By joining EF, you become part of a multicultural community active in over 50 countries, with hundreds of schools and offices worldwide. Our mission is to open the world through education. No matter your background or passions, we welcome you and hope you will share this vision with us.

EF is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, committed to inclusion and belonging, regardless of origin, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, or experience.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, with regional headquarters in Boston, London, São Paulo, Tokyo, Zurich, and more.

EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults. All positions are subject to criminal background and/or reference checks, as applicable.

enhanced_info.title: CSM / Relation clientèle - 100% télétravail
enhanced_info.description:
Chez Teliosa, notre mission est de rendre la thérapie plus accessiblePourquoi la thérapie ?615 millions de personnes souffrent de grave problème de santé mentaleLe covid a empiré les chosesDes personnes en grande souffrance n’arrivent pas à trouver la bonne personne pour les aider.
Qu’est-ce qu’ont fait ?On aide les thérapeutes à aider plus de monde
Comment on le fait?On a créé un programme qui donne aux thérapeutes les outils, les connaissances et l’accompagnement nécessaire pour réussir
En 3 ans, on est passés de 0 à2000 thérapeutes accompagnés5 millions € de CA/an - 70 % de net profitUne équipe de 15 personnes
En 2025, on veut :Grossir à 10 million € de revenuAider 1000 thérapeutes
Vous postulez pour la partie francaise : https://teliosa.com/
Nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) Customer Success Manager (CSM) pour notre formation.
Ta mission sera :Animer des sessions live sur Zoom pour aider nos élèves thérapeutes à développer leur activité (business et marketing)Répondre aux questions de nos élèves sur le groupe Facebook privéFavoriser une énergie positive dans les échanges pour générer un maximum d'avis et témoignages positifsCollecter les retours sur notre programme pour l'améliorer en continu
Les choses sur lesquelles tu travailleras :Stratégie marketing pour thérapeutesDéveloppement du mindset entrepreneurialCréation et customisation de sites internet avec LeadpagesUtilisation stratégique des réseaux sociaux pour développer son activité gratuitementOptimisation SEOConfiguration et amélioration des fiches Google My BusinessMise en place de campagnes Google Ads et Facebook Ads
Ce job est fait pour toi si :Tu as une expérience dans la relation client, l'accompagnement d'entrepreneurs ou de thérapeutesTu t’intéresses au marketing digitalesTu aimes partager ton savoir et voir les autres réussir grâce à tes conseilsTu es à l'aise avec les outils digitals et les réseaxu sociauxTu as des bases en Google Ads et Facebook AdsTu es dynamique, positif(ve) et sais créer une ambiance motivanteTu es bienveillant(e) et coachable
Ce n'est pas fait pour toi si :Tu n'aimes pas le contact humain et l'animation de groupeTu préfères travailler sur des projets ponctuels sans suiviTu n'es pas à l'aise avec les outils digitauxTu n'as pas d'intérêt pour le secteur du bien-être et de la thérapie
Les choses cools que tu auras :L'opportunité d'aider des thérapeutes à développer leur activité et avoir un impact positifL'opportunité de progresser et de te perfectionner dans de multiples domaines complémentaires (marketing digital, techniques de vente, gestion de la relation client)Beaucoup d'autonomie dans ton travailRejoindre une équipe dynamique et passionnéeLa possibilité de travailler à distance (100% télétravail)Un environnement de travail stimulant et en constante évolutionL'accès à une communauté engagée de professionnels du bien-être
Chez nous, pas de CV ni de lettre de motivation, seules les skills comptent !
Il suffit de remplir ce questionnaire et nous vous recontacterons :https://3pvzkf2zd8p.typeform.com/to/l0YduVsJ

enhanced_info.title: Lead User Acquisition Manager - Gaming
enhanced_info.description:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Growth team is a transversal entity aiming to maximize and deliver the potential of any mobile product. It combines user acquisition, creative content production, monetization, and the tech capabilities required to turn applications into global hits. With over 150 experts, we operate at the forefront of mobile marketing and ad tech across various types of games (hypercasual, hybrid, 100% IAP).

Role

Build and grow your dream teamRecruit outstanding UA talent and help them thrive.Coach underperformers and make tough calls when necessary.Create a performance-driven, collaborative team culture.
Lead UA strategy across multiple game launches

Define tunnel-wide growth strategies for your entire gaming portfolio.Partner with studios to align on targets, timings, and tactics.Own flawless execution—your team delivers, no matter what.

Personally manage our top-performing games

Take direct ownership of UA for some of our highest-priority titles.Set the standard for strategy, execution, and performance within the team.Lead by example through hands-on campaign management and optimization.

Boost performance, every day

Dive into campaign data to identify opportunities and signals.Increase ROAS across channels through creative iteration and data insights.Set up clear forecasting, pacing, and growth reporting.

Collaborate to unlock growth multipliers

Partner closely with studios, product managers, creative strategists, data scientists and more.Shape product decisions through a growth lens.Test bold ideas and deploy innovative UA tactics across the portfolio.

Shape the tools that power our growth

Use our in-house UA automation systems.

Provide structured feedback to stakeholders in order to continuously improve performance.

Be a thought leader

Share UA insights and growth innovations across the org.Mentor peers and contribute to a learning culture.Drive cross-functional initiatives that raise the bar for growth excellence.

Profile

Battle-tested in mobile gaming UA5+ years in performance marketing / UA, with real impact on high-scale mobile games.Proven leadership experienceYou've led and grown high-performing teams and know how to spot (and coach) top talent.Paid acquisition expertMastery of major UA platforms: Meta, TikTok, Applovin, AdMob, DSPs…Deep understanding of MMPs (Appsflyer, Adjust), SKAN, and attribution dynamics.Analytical & creative problem-solverComfortable navigating spreadsheets, statistical tools, and creative testing frameworks.You know when to trust your gut—and when to trust the data.Experimentation mindsetYou think in test plans and incremental wins.You structure learning loops that scale.Entrepreneurial and adaptableThrive in a fast-paced, ambitious environment.You get things done and keep pushing the frontier.Excellent communicator and collaboratorYou drive alignment across disciplines and keep people inspired.Fluent in English (French is a plus, but not a must.)
Benefits

Competitive salary based on experienceSwile Lunch voucherGymlib (100% covered by Voodoo)Premium healthcare coverage with SideCare, 100% covered for you and your familyWellness activities in our Paris officeRemote days on Fridays

enhanced_info.title: Head of Growth - BeReal
enhanced_info.description:
About BeReal

At BeReal, we are dedicated to authenticity in social media. By encouraging users to share unfiltered moments, we foster genuine connections and celebrate real life. We are now an international team of 70+ and have 40M+ monthly active users. Backed by Voodoo, our team is fully focused on scaling BeReal into an iconic social network used by hundreds of millions.

Role

As Head of Growth - you will be responsible for scaling BeReal worldwide, reporting to the CEO and working closely with Voodoo’s central growth team.

You will build and lead a team of 5+ people to cover all growth activities. The ideal candidate is a data-driven leader with a structured mindset, a passion for growth, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment.

Build the growth strategy to scale BeReal’s user base. Drive the execution of all user acquisition channels (including paid UA, product-led growth, offline activities, partnerships, PR, content production, influencer marketing, organic growth, community management, ASO and app store relationships.) Partner with cross-functional teams and product teams to ensure execution of the growth strategy and leverage resources effectivelyConduct systematic data analysis and leverage key metrics to measure channels performances, drive decision-making, prioritize growth initiatives and new opportunities.Stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitors’ growth strategies to identify innovative activations

Profile

You have at least 5-8 years of experience, and a proven track record in driving growth for consumer-facing digital product, preferably in social media or mobile appsYou already have leadership experiences with the ability to inspire and manage a team of 5+ peopleYou understand the mobile growth ecosystem in detail as well as branding performance You are a data-driven, growth hacker with an entrepreneurial mindset and can adapt to a high-paced environmentYou can demonstrate excellent teamwork and collaboration skillsYou are fluent in English (fluency in French is a plus)

Benefits

Competitive salary upon experienceSwile Lunch voucherGymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)Premium healthcare coverage SideCare, for your family 100% borne by VoodooWellness activities in our Paris office
