enhanced_info.title: Global Online & Strategy Manager
enhanced_info.description:
Amex GBT is a place where colleagues find inspiration in travel as a force for good and – through their work – can make an impact on our industry. We’re here to help our colleagues achieve success and offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where your voice is valued.

Global Online Strategy and Maintenance Manager

The Global Online Strategy Manager provides insight and support for all online solutions to the account management team and Schneider Electric travel leaders to enable effective interface of online tools with enterprise associates, efficient implementation of new features & releases, and realization of savings goals.

Skills:

Strong Concur environment knowledge and expertiseStrong understanding of global travel online operations, suppliers, and systemsHighly developed Project & Change management skills.Strong analytical thinker combined with written and verbal communication skills.Proven experience relating to the creation and delivery of business process strategies for large global clients.Demonstrated ability to work successfully across cultures and regions and the ability to work with cross-functional teams and to influence both internally and externally.Confident approach to presentations, client & internal meetings.Strong PC knowledge including related PowerPoint/Excel/ Microsoft Project/Email skills. In depth understanding of drivers for customer satisfaction in the business travel industry.


The Global Online Strategy manager will:

Global Strategy & Project Manager:Responsible Global Online life cycle: innovative leader, strategic thinker with a focus on program optimizationsupport the client, client management and customer’s contacts on a day-to-day basisLead the SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC Global travel programResponsible for driving innovative travel strategy balancing operational efficiency with a high touch service for the traveller experience.Develop Global & regional online adoption targets and market strategies for an intuitive online booking experience: Train, Monitor program status and savingsDevelop strategy plans, leader for customer expansion, future markets or technology implementation.Handle multiple priorities and deliver to often tight timeframes.Lead SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC Travel expansion, foresee markets implementations, expansion and technical sites optimization & site maintenance.Ensure the business requirements are aligned with global strategic objectives of both Amex GBT/partner and SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC.Special projects management: e.g. support SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC with new acquisitions and strategy.Online site reviews – Technical support to improve adoption levels including additional `new` functionalitylarge maintenance projects:Amex GBT Pre-Release – Testing and Post Release - Site updatesConcur Pre-Release – Testing and Post Release - Site updatesCSAT/Verbatim: analysis, solutions, recommendations shared

Implementation & Deployment manager Interact and support client in special projects and day-to-day requests such as Policy Exception management, crisis managementSupports Client and Client Management team leveraging project management,Implementation & deployment of Manage the Online tool roll out according to the project plan.Lead Concur Travel implementation programming & expansion of Concur Travel in new markets. Collaborate with GBT partners/JVs to develop and deploy Concur Travel in new countriesLead implementation of new booking function (Booking.com/Sponsored Guest …)Lead integration of new technology (Digital messages//Connect Update/OneGBT…) Interface with SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC’s travel program key contacts and technology teams, Amex product stakeholders, and online suppliers to implement, Development and support web applicationsGlobal solutions planning, developing, testing, and deployment of Concur functionalities, GDS & Local specifics.Amex GBT internal project impacting Online: Creation, development and communication of joint project plansProvide continuing support into current, upcoming, or developing technologiesMaximize tool capabilities to support enterprise policy and supplier strategies and ongoing program goals.Support the implementation of the Amex approved technology solutions that improve service delivery and execution of travel management demands.Key linkage for all advisories and future planning with key partners in American express i.e. Consulting, Card/Payment and MeetingsContinuing analysis and insight into current, upcoming, or developing technologies and benefits of integration or exclusion from program as per the industry and/or American ExpressConcur/Sustainability



Global Online Site Administrator, Support and Maintenance ManagerGlobal Site administrator on the Concur online booking tool. Implements vendor (air, rental car, hotel, etc.) agreements and monitors compliance with reporting, tracking data, knowledge on opportunities/challenges with performances of goals, etc. Client Travel Policy – Maintain the master list of Client travel policies. Ensure that Operations is notified of any changes and updates to the policies in OBTAirline, Car, Rail, Ground and Hotel Contracts – Maintain the vendor contracts in OBT + maintain Policy Rules & Messages Hotel:Handle the administrative aspects of the Hotel RFP. Hotel Maintenance: Load in OBT Preferred Properties, Preferred chains, Hotel Rate caps, Hotel policy Rules, Hotel messages Hotel policy Rules updates (Currency fluctuation)Bi-weekly Hotel calls: overview, action plans & milestones.AIR:Preferred airlines OBT upload and maintenanceAir policy Rules updates (Currency fluctuation)Update: Airline safety ratingBi-weekly Air calls: overview, action plans & milestones.CAR:Preferred Car OBT upload and maintenanceCar policy Rules updates (Currency fluctuation)Client Issues2nd level Tech support: Issue resolution/Vendor escalations/Outage &/or Maintenance communicationResearch and respond to client issues. Or open Salesforce/SNAP tickets for the relevant dept to research. Key linkage with the travel team to secure access to all needed resources, products, services and support. Daily maintenance of the Concur Travel live sites (GBT/Concur updates, new functionality, enhancement)Second technical travel support- provide support to incoming requests/questions or concerns received from the customer, users, Travel GBT/TPN teamCreate/maintain Concur casesCreate/maintain Solution Suggestions in ConcurCollaborate w/ Concur for prioritizing SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC CasesTrack changes/updates/enhancement applied through SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC Market requirement documents (40) & Global SCHNEIDER ELECTRIC Concur documentCommunication maintenance:Elaboration and Maintenance Concur Profile GuidesElaboration and Maintenance Concur Travel Getting Started FAQ

Global Online Strategy and Maintenance Manager

The Global Online Strategy Manager provides insight and support for all online solutions to the account management team and Schneider Electric travel leaders to enable effective interface of online tools with enterprise associates, efficient implementation of new features & releases, and realization of savings goals.

enhanced_info.title: Country Manager (France)
enhanced_info.description:
Join Hostinger and we’ll grow fast! 🚀

Is there a limit to growth? Not at Hostinger.

We’re constantly reaching new heights. With a team of 900 professionals, we are behind the success of over 4 million clients in 150 countries, helping them launch their e-shops, blogs, portfolios, businesses, and passion projects.

Our mission: To build world-class solutions for anyone to easily succeed online

Our culture: Guided by  10 company principles 

Our formula for success: Customer obsession, innovative products, and talented teams.

Your role at Hostinger

Country manager in the international growth team. As part of Hostinger's international growth team, you'll be responsible for growing Hostinger’s market share in the France. You will focus on understanding target customers, evaluating channels, optimizing key metrics, and setting strategic country-level goals.

Curious to learn more? Connect with your team: Yaroslav Stepanenko, Head of International Growth

Your Day-to-day

Market Expansion & Investment Design and fully own the end-to-end go-to-market strategy for the France, ensuring incremental growth in market share across all efforts.Lead comprehensive market and channel analysis to identify key growth drivers and implement changes to increase market share.Own marketing budget allocation based on historical data, opportunity size, and strategic goals. Ensure a balance between:Immediate performance Long-term investments Tests & researches Align investments based on seasonality and local competition.Balance short-term tactical needs with long-term sustainable growth objectives.Business Development & PartnershipsUnlock high-impact partnerships with businesses, opinion leaders, and governmental entities to scale growth.Focus on strategic, high-value partnerships rather than executing small-scale tactical initiatives.Cross-Functional CollaborationWork with Marketing teams on channel-specific execution, ensuring alignment between global and country strategies.Provide localization direction to ensure brand messaging resonates in the market.Inform hiring roadmaps based on growth objectives and market-specific needs.Be the Primary VOC: Voice of Country, Voice of Customer & Voice of CompanyProvide critical market intelligence, trends, and cultural insights to drive key decisions on pricing, campaigns, and product development.Drive customer research initiatives to uncover hidden cohorts and untapped opportunities.Ensure Hostinger is perceived as a trusted brand in the market.Act as the voice and the face of the company in the local markets

Your Skills And Experience

Proven experience and a deep understanding of the France market.Skilled in analyzing customer needs, market trends, and the competitive landscape.Proficient in setting country-level goals, evaluating opportunities, and formulating market entry or expansion strategies.Experienced in managing budgets, optimizing LTV/CAC, ROAS, and ensuring profitability.Adept at identifying effective channels, driving revenue growth, and executing go-to-market strategies.Capable of overseeing execution, managing cross-functional teams, and ensuring operational efficiency.Experienced in building partnerships, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, and managing contracts.Skilled in navigating market challenges, regulatory changes, and business uncertainties.Effective at presenting ideas, aligning teams, and advocating for business priorities.Proficient in leveraging analytics and insights to enhance business performance.

Benefits For You

🚀 360 Growth: We provide limitless learning opportunities: access to platforms like Reforge and Scribd, global conferences, feedback culture, digital libraries and industry-leading subscriptions. Advance your career with internal mobility and grow with a team eager to share knowledge and support your success.🎯 Freedom & Responsibility: Work on your terms, whether from the comfort of home or anywhere in the world. With a home office budget, you can elevate your workspace. Enjoy the flexibility to manage your schedule while bringing your ideas to life in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.💪Wellness Simplified: Your health comes first with company-provided sick days, 20 paid suspension days, and recharge leave. Participate in global sports challenges and simply enjoy the balance of a lifestyle that prioritizes wellness.🎉 Work Hard, Party Hard: Recognize hard work with company events like Town Hall, Meet the Client initiatives, team-building experiences, and workations. Celebrate life’s big moments with milestone gifts for weddings, new parenthood, and graduations.

Compensation

Gross salary 70000 to 90000 EUR/year (depending on your experience).

Get ready to take your personal and professional growth to new heights! Join Hostinger today and be part of our journey 🚀

Three. Two. Onboard

Three. Two. Onboard

enhanced_info.title: Product Marketing Manager
enhanced_info.description:
We provide the DevOps automation platform built to empower developers. From cloud infrastructure provisioning to production deployment, Qovery streamlines every step, enabling faster delivery, simplified workflows, and significant time savings.

🤩 Why is your role important?

As Qovery’s first Product Marketing Manager, you will lay the foundation for how our story is told to the world. You’ll shape the way we position ourselves in a crowded DevOps and cloud market, crafting messaging that cuts through the noise and resonates with both developers and business buyers. This role is pivotal in giving clarity to our narrative, enabling the sales team, and helping our users understand the real value of choosing Qovery.

🚀 What will your job look like

As our first Product Marketing Manager, you’ll be both strategist and builder. Your mission will be to:

Define positioning and messaging that makes Qovery’s value clear to developers, platform teams, and business stakeholders. Enable our sales team with the right tools (battlecards, one-pagers, pitch decks) to communicate our story with clarity and impact. Shape our go-to-market strategy for new features and product launches, ensuring we stand out in a crowded DevOps/CloudOps market. Collaborate with Product and Engineering to translate complex technology into simple, compelling narratives. Lead market research and competitive analysis to keep us ahead of industry trends and sharpen our differentiation. Support demand generation with content and campaigns that attract and educate prospects. Embody Qovery’s Culture: Collaborate in a caring, transparent, and innovative environment, building authentic relationships with customers and colleagues.

This is a role for someone who thrives in an early-stage environment: you’ll have freedom to experiment, influence strategy directly, and set the standards for Product Marketing at Qovery.

💡 About you

We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager who is equal parts storyteller and strategist. Someone who can dive deep into our product, empathize with developers and platform teams, and translate technical complexity into messages that resonate.

Here’s What Will Help You Succeed

Experience in B2B SaaS — ideally in DevOps, Cloud, Platform Engineering, or a technical developer-focused product. A builder’s mindset — you’ve shaped Product Marketing in a growing company before, or you’re eager to take on that challenge for the first time. Strong communication skills — you can switch seamlessly between writing clear, concise copy and building narratives for executives, customers, and sales teams. Analytical and curious — you like to dig into customer insights, market research, and data to inform positioning and strategy. Collaborative by nature — you work well with Product, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing, and know how to bridge technical and commercial worlds. Hands-on and proactive — in a small team, you’re comfortable rolling up your sleeves and making things happen.

Most importantly, you share our values: ownership, transparency, and a developer-first mindset.

🎯 What You’ll Get at Qovery

Competitive Compensation.Comprehensive Benefits.Flexible Work Setup: Remote-first culture; work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection.Learning Opportunities: Professional development and growth supported from day one.Innovative Environment: Join a high-growth startup pushing boundaries in cloud technology.Authentic Culture: Collaborate with a team that values care, innovation, and customer success.

💥 Our Talent Acquisition Process

We’ve designed a streamlined process to ensure a great candidate experience. Typically, it takes 3-4 weeks:

Initial Call: Meet with Marie or Ludwig to discuss your experience, motivation, and career goals.Hiring Manager Interview: A 60-minute deep dive into your sales skills and collaboration experience.Workshop/Case Study PresentationFinal Round: Meet with a co-founder and leadership to discuss alignment with Qovery’s values and mission.Reference Checks: Validate performance, integrity, and alignment with our needs.

We’re committed to keeping you informed throughout the process, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

enhanced_info.title: Head of People
enhanced_info.description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

The Revolut People team is pivotal to how we support our people and manage a seamless experience for them each day. From onboarding flows to line manager coaching and development, our goal is to create a partnership with our teams that is people-centric and value-adding.

We're growing rapidly, and to support this expansion, we're looking for a Head of People to drive our People strategy in France and support growth across Europe. You’ll shape policies and procedures and embed culture across the team.

If you're a data-oriented and results-driven expert with outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills, who is passionate about building scalable processes and helping others grow, this might be the next challenge you're after.

What You'll Be Doing

Acting as a strategic advisor and coach to leadership, supporting organisational development, cultural integration, and high-impact decision-makingDeveloping and implementing HR policies and procedures that meet Revolut’s standards and local French employment regulationsSupporting the operationalisation of the French-licensed entity, aligning HR processes to regulatory requirements, and contributing to our expansion strategyPartnering with Central HR to optimise day-to-day operations, drive automation, and ensure customer-centricityOwning performance management, employee relations, and disciplinary processesMonitoring compliance with local employment laws, including direct liaison with relevant French authorities (e.g., inspection du travail)Promoting Revolut’s culture and values while embedding diversity, equity, and inclusion in day-to-day operationsProviding cultural coaching to enable effective cross-border collaborationLeading People initiatives that support business goals, from compensation benchmarking to training and engagement programmesHelping build a balanced scorecard and success metrics for the new entity

What You'll Need

8–10 years of experience in HR, with significant exposure to high-growth or regulated environments (e.g., fintech, banking, scale-ups)Proven success as a strategic HR business partner or Head of People in an international, multicultural contextDeep knowledge of French labour law and regulatory requirementsExperience with policy development, performance management, and complianceAn analytical mindset and experience working with data-driven HR practicesFluency in English and French

Nice to have

Experience working in or supporting a regulated financial institutionKnowledge of banking-specific HR controls or compliance frameworksExpertise building HR operations from scratch in a startup or scale-upExperience working within group-wide and local HR structures

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

About The Role

The Revolut People team is pivotal to how we support our people and manage a seamless experience for them each day. From onboarding flows to line manager coaching and development, our goal is to create a partnership with our teams that is people-centric and value-adding.

We're growing rapidly, and to support this expansion, we're looking for a Head of People to drive our People strategy in France and support growth across Europe. You’ll shape policies and procedures and embed culture across the team.

If you're a data-oriented and results-driven expert with outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills, who is passionate about building scalable processes and helping others grow, this might be the next challenge you're after.

What You'll Be Doing

Acting as a strategic advisor and coach to leadership, supporting organisational development, cultural integration, and high-impact decision-makingDeveloping and implementing HR policies and procedures that meet Revolut’s standards and local French employment regulationsSupporting the operationalisation of the French-licensed entity, aligning HR processes to regulatory requirements, and contributing to our expansion strategyPartnering with Central HR to optimise day-to-day operations, drive automation, and ensure customer-centricityOwning performance management, employee relations, and disciplinary processesMonitoring compliance with local employment laws, including direct liaison with relevant French authorities (e.g., inspection du travail)Promoting Revolut’s culture and values while embedding diversity, equity, and inclusion in day-to-day operationsProviding cultural coaching to enable effective cross-border collaborationLeading People initiatives that support business goals, from compensation benchmarking to training and engagement programmesHelping build a balanced scorecard and success metrics for the new entity

What You'll Need

8–10 years of experience in HR, with significant exposure to high-growth or regulated environments (e.g., fintech, banking, scale-ups)Proven success as a strategic HR business partner or Head of People in an international, multicultural contextDeep knowledge of French labour law and regulatory requirementsExperience with policy development, performance management, and complianceAn analytical mindset and experience working with data-driven HR practicesFluency in English and French

Nice to have

Experience working in or supporting a regulated financial institutionKnowledge of banking-specific HR controls or compliance frameworksExpertise building HR operations from scratch in a startup or scale-upExperience working within group-wide and local HR structures

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

enhanced_info.title: Digital & Editorial Communication Manager (F/H)
enhanced_info.description:
Riche de 140 années d’histoire, Tarkett est un leader mondial des solutions innovantes de revêtements de sol et de surfaces sportives. Le Groupe a réalisé un chiffre d’affaires de 3,3 milliards d’euros en 2024.

Tarkett conçoit, fabrique et vend une large gamme de solutions intégrant des sols vinyles, linoléum, caoutchouc, moquettes, parquets et stratifiés, gazons synthétiques et pistes d’athlétisme auprès des hôpitaux, des écoles, de l’habitat, des hôtels, des bureaux ou commerces et des terrains de sport.

Avec près de 12 000 collaborateurs, 35 sites de production, 24 centres de R&D, 8 centres de recyclage, le Groupe sert ses clients dans plus de 100 pays dans le monde. 

Engagé dans une démarche d’économie circulaire et de réduction de son empreinte carbone, le Groupe met en place une stratégie d'éco-innovation inspirée des principes Cradle to Cradle®, alignée avec son approche Tarkett Human-Conscious Design®.

Au sein de l’équipe Communication Groupe et rattaché(e) à la Directrice Communication Groupe, nous recherchons notre futur(e) Responsable Communication (digitale & éditoriale) /  Digital & Editorial Communication Manager (F/H) en CDI, basé à La Défense.

Vos Missions :

En tant que Responsable Communication (digitale & éditoriale), vous piloterez et mettrez en œuvre des initiatives de communication à la fois au niveau Groupe et au niveau de la division EMEA. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le renforcement de la visibilité corporate de Tarkett, l’animation des communautés internes, et la mise en place d’expériences digitales de qualité à travers les canaux propriétaires du Groupe.

Pour cela, vous interviendrez sur les points suivants :

Développement de la stratégie digitale & éditoriale :Vous contribuerez au plan de communication annuel groupe, avec un focus particulier sur les stratégies éditoriales et digitales. Vous serez en charge de suivre et piloter votre budget (outils digitaux, prestataires externes, ...) mais également d’optimiser les coûts et les dépenses sur les différents sujets de communication.Vous participerez à l’élaboration du calendrier éditorial à travers l’intranet, le site web, les réseaux sociaux et la newsletter.

Communication digitale externe : Vous serez en charge d’activer la communication digitale externe : vous travaillerez la stratégie réseaux sociaux Tarkett afin d’en faire un levier stratégique pour le groupe et les divisions. Pour ce faire vous veillerez à la qualité, la pertinence et la régularité des contenus en lien avec les équipes locales. 

Communication digitale interne : Vous serez le référent fonctionnel et le garant de l’Intranet Groupe. Vous travaillerez avec les différents collaborateurs (IT, divisions, pays, usines, ...) sur les évolutions et améliorations.Vous piloterez l’animation éditoriale de l’intranet EMEA en identifiant les sujets clés, en proposant des formats engageants, ...
Vos Qualifications et Compétences :

Vous êtes titulaire d’un Bac+5 spécialisé en en communication et/ou médias digitaux. Vous justifiez d’une expérience de 8 ans minimum dans des fonctions similaires au sein d’un grand groupe international. Vous êtes bilingue anglais / français avec une excellente plume dans les deux langues.Vous maitrisez les plateformes digitales, les stratégies éditoriales et vous savez piloter des projets transverses complexes. Vous avez un excellent relationnel, vous aimez travailler en équipe et en transverse. Vous êtes dynamique, proactif(ve), orienté(e) solutions et vous disposez d’un leadership naturel vous permettant de mettre en avant vos projets de manière créative et pragmatique !Enfin, vous avez un fort esprit analytique vous permettant d’exploiter les données afin de travailler en amélioration continue.

Les avantages que nous offrons: 

Au-delà du salaire, nous offrons un ensemble d'avantages, dont un variable indexé sur la performance collective et individuelle, une prime d'intéressement, 2 jours de télétravail par semaine, 13 RTT, une couverture santé renforcée (Alan), une carte tickets restaurant, des remises collaborateurs sur des offres Tarkett, et d'autres encore qui vous seront commentés au fur et à mesure.

Process de recrutement: 

Premiers échanges, téléphonique puis présentiel, avec Sarah, équipe Talent AcquisitionTest d’anglais Entretien avec Marie, votre managerDernier échange avec Sanja, DRH du périmètre EMEA-LATAM

Retrouvez-nous sur: Welcome to the Jungle !

Tarkett recrute aux compétences et privilégie l’égalité des chances et la diversité au sein des équipes, notamment en faveur de l’égalité femmes-hommes, de la mixité sociale, du handicap et de l’intergénérationnel. 

By joining us, you will be part of an international culture where you can expand your horizons, change the game and design the future of society. And where our values of collaboration, creativity, commitment and caring underpin our success.

Come and see how is life at Tarkett!

https://careers.tarkett.com/en/home.html

enhanced_info.title: Chargé(e) de marketing omnicanal et data client (F/H)
enhanced_info.description:
Filiale du Groupe Manutan, Casal Sport est leader en France depuis 45 ans, dans la vente de matériel et d’équipements de sport aux collectivités, établissements scolaires et clubs sportifs, avec pour mission de « Stimuler la pratique du sport ensemble ». Nous sommes une équipe de plus de 120 collaborateurs passionnés, dynamiques et performants, basés à Altorf (67) à 20km de Strasbourg (Gare TER puis 7 minutes à pied) Casal Sport cherche un(e) Chargé(e) de marketing omnicanal et data client. Mission principale
Sous la responsabilité du Responsable Marketing Client, vous êtes chargé(e) d’analyser en profondeur la dynamique de notre parc client pour identifier les leviers de croissance sur nos marchés stratégiques : collectivités, enseignement, clubs. Vous êtes également garant(e) de la coordination des opérations marketing client mensuelles sur l’ensemble des canaux de vente et de communication (e-commerce, forces de vente terrain, service client, réseaux sociaux…).Votre rôle s’articule autour de cinq piliers :L’analyse des comportements et de la performance client à partir de données concrètesL’identification des problématiques par typologie client, canal et zone géographiqueLa mise en œuvre (avec l’équipe marketing) d’actions correctrices ou d’accélérationLa coordination et l’adaptation des opérations du plan marketing clientLa garantie d’une mise à jour et de l’enrichissement de la base de données en continu
Responsabilités
Analyse du parc client et diagnostic businessAnalyser l’évolution du parc par typologie de clients : nouveaux, fidèles, dormants, perdus à travers les différents tableaux de bords et KPIs mis à dispositionMettre en évidence les causes possibles à partir des données disponibles : chiffres d’affaires, devis, fréquence d’achat, panier moyen…Traduire ces constats en actions en collaboration avec l’ensemble des parties prenantes (service marketing client, responsable nationale des ventes, marketing de l’offre…)Suivre les résultats des actions et les ajuster selon les retours marché pour maximiser la performance
Coordination des opérations marketing clientAssurer la mise en œuvre des opérations prévues dans le plan marketing mensuel par marché (collectivités, enseignement et associations sportives)Veiller à la cohérence et à la déclinaison des actions sur tous les canaux :Digital (site, emailings, bannières)Print (catalogue, outils d’aide à la vente)CRM (campagnes commerciales, ciblage)Réseaux sociaux (contenus, campagnes sponsorisées)Coordonner les opérations avec les équipes opérationnelles : marketing, commerce, création, service client.
Suivi de la performance et amélioration continueProduire et mettre à jour les tableaux de bord de pilotage clientAssurer le reporting régulier des KPIs relationnels : activation, fidélisation, taux d’attrition, réachatÊtre force de proposition sur les outils à optimiser (CRM, BI, tableaux de suivi, base de données client)
Collaboration avec le gestionnaire de la base clientTravailler étroitement avec le gestionnaire de la base client, garant de la qualité, de la structuration et de la qualification des données Participer à l’amélioration continue des données utilisées pour les ciblages, segmentations et analyses, et en suivre les indicateurs de qualité
Ce que ce poste vous offre :
Un rôle central dans le pilotage de la stratégie client au sein d’une organisation structuréeUn fort niveau de responsabilité dans l’analyse et la prise de décisions marketingUne exposition à des projets stratégiques dans un environnement B2B omnicanal, avec un lien direct entre les actions menées et les résultats commerciaux
Un cadre stimulant pour les passionné(e)s de sport, où votre esprit d'équipe et votre affinité avec cet univers feront toute la différence. Ici, votre amour du terrain se transforme en levier de performance marketing !

raw_detailed_info.title: Chargé(e) de marketing omnicanal et data client (F/H)

enhanced_info.title: Head of Marketing (EMEA, United Kingdom, Ireland)
enhanced_info.description:
About The Role

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity—and a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we’ve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people’s lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many. This is a future with more voices rather than fewer.

About The Role

We are searching for a marketing leader to drive our up-market growth across the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region. As the Head of Marketing, EMEA, you will lead marketing's contribution to our regional business goals.

This is a pivotal leadership role. You will sit on the EMEA Senior Leadership Team (SLT), serving as the voice of marketing and a key architect of our regional strategy. You will lead through a combination of direct team management and cross-functional influence to ensure Marketing exceeds its overall pipeline goals. Your mission is clear: build a world-class marketing function that delivers predictable, scalable pipeline and drives revenue.

What You'll Do

Set the Regional Strategy: As a member of the EMEA SLT, co-own the regional revenue targets and develop the overarching marketing strategy to drive market penetration and meet our growth goals.Lead & Develop Your Team: Directly lead, coach, and inspire a high-performing regional team focused on Account-Based Marketing (ABM) and local campaigns, fostering a culture of accountability and impact.Represent Marketing Results: Take accountability for total regional marketing performance. You'll do this by building exceptional partnerships with global functional teams—including Partner, Events, Brand, and Performance Marketing—to rally the cross-functional team behind EMEA’s strategic priorities.Immerse in the Data: Hunt for funnel insights to refine marketing strategies for distinct customer segments and countries. Conduct frequent analysis on program performance to scale efforts, ensure an efficient marketing mix, and achieve KPIs.AI Reflexivity: You lead the team from the front when it comes to pushing the boundaries of AI usage to drive efficiency and impact.Communicate & Influence: Communicate insights, learnings, results, and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels on a regular cadence, ensuring alignment and celebrating progress.Be the Voice of the Region: Translate our global brand campaigns into locally resonant "expressions" that connect with customers across EMEA, providing critical market feedback back into global teams.


What You'll Bring

A significant track record of B2B marketing leadership within the EMEA technology or SaaS sector, with a clear history of exceeding pipeline and revenue targets.Deep expertise in building demand generation engines, particularly with Account-Based Marketing (ABM) programs, working in close partnership with Sales and Partnerships groups.A tendency to lead from a position of being in the work, with the team, as a deep craft expert.A talent for building, coaching, and inspiring high-performing teams. You are a leader who develops leaders.An ability to thrive in chaos, resolve ambiguity, and be solutions-oriented. You have a proven ability to juggle multiple high-impact projects and rally teams behind solutions.Mastery of leading in a matrixed environment. You excel at driving results through both direct reports and high-leverage, cross-functional influence.Deeply proficient in modern marketing technology and data systems.


Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyone.Excel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowth.Keep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter).Be resilient and resourceful in the face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) change.Bring critical thought and opinion.Use AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflow.Embrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forward.Work digital-first for your daily work.


About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we’ve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people’s lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many, is a future with more voices rather than fewer, and is creating more choices instead of an elite option.

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity—and a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyoneExcel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowthKeep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter)Be resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) changeBring critical thought and opinionUse AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflowEmbrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forwardWork digital-first for your daily work

A significant track record of B2B marketing leadership within the EMEA technology or SaaS sector, with a clear history of exceeding pipeline and revenue targets.Deep expertise in building demand generation engines, particularly with Account-Based Marketing (ABM) programs, working in close partnership with Sales and Partnerships groups.A tendency to lead from a position of being in the work, with the team, as a deep craft expert.A talent for building, coaching, and inspiring high-performing teams. You are a leader who develops leaders.An ability to thrive in chaos, resolve ambiguity, and be solutions-oriented. You have a proven ability to juggle multiple high-impact projects and rally teams behind solutions.Mastery of leading in a matrixed environment. You excel at driving results through both direct reports and high-leverage, cross-functional influence.Deeply proficient in modern marketing technology and data systems.


Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyone.Excel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowth.Keep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter).Be resilient and resourceful in the face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) change.Bring critical thought and opinion.Use AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflow.Embrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forward.Work digital-first for your daily work.


About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we’ve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people’s lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many, is a future with more voices rather than fewer, and is creating more choices instead of an elite option.

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity—and a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyoneExcel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowthKeep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter)Be resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) changeBring critical thought and opinionUse AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflowEmbrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forwardWork digital-first for your daily work

enhanced_info.title: French Content writer
enhanced_info.description:
Innodata (NASDAQ: INOD) is a leading data engineering company. With more than 2,000 customers and operations in 13 cities around the world, we are an AI technology solutions provider-of-choice for 4 out of 5 of the world’s biggest technology companies, as well as leading companies across financial services, insurance, technology, law, and medicine.By combining advanced machine learning and artificial intelligence (ML/AI) technologies, a global workforce of subject matter experts, and a high-security infrastructure, we’re helping usher in the promise of AI. Innodata offers a powerful combination of both digital data solutions and easy-to-use, high-quality platforms.
Our global workforce includes over 5,000 employees in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, the Philippines, India, Sri Lanka, Israel and Germany.

Job Title: Content WriterLocation: RemoteEngagement: Project-based / ContractualRequired Engagement: 6 hours per day Language Requirement: Native ( France)
About the Role:
We are seeking native French speakers to contribute to a variety of AI-related projects involving content creation and data annotation. The primary responsibility will be writing and reviewing original, high-quality content in French. Other tasks may include prompt creation, translation, translation review, and content labelling.
This role is well-suited for individuals with strong writing skills, keen attention to detail, and the ability to work independently while adhering to project guidelines.
Key Responsibilities:
Create, evaluate, or refine content based on specific project requirementsWrite prompts and responses in french across a wide range of topics.Review and assess AI-generated responses to ensure quality and relevanceTranslate content between English and french, ensuring fluency and cultural appropriatenessAnnotate and label German -language content related to current events, media, and culture
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher, with at least 3 years of relevant experienceNative-level fluency in French and strong English skillsExperience in content writing and evaluating prompt-based tasksExcellent written communication in FrenchFamiliarity with AI tools such as conversational agents or content generation platformsPrior experience in translation, translation review, or data annotation is a plusSelf-motivated and deadline-orientedStrong attention to detail and the ability to follow instructions precisely

enhanced_info.title: Manager Marketing Offres de paiement et encaissement H/F
enhanced_info.description:
Description du poste

En tant que manager marketing offres de paiement & encaissement vous aurez pour mission principale la gestion quotidienne du pôle marketing flux et encaissement et de la coordination de l’ensemble des projets. Vous jouerez un rôle de relais opérationnel et décisionnel en représentant la direction Marketing dans certaines instances, tout en assurant une supervision rigoureuse des équipes et des projets.

Le poste est stratégique, exigeant, et requiert une expertise approfondie du secteur des paiements, en particulier des offres de paiement sur le marché B2B.

Responsabilités :

 Encadrement des équipes (6 personnes) :Superviser et coordonner les activités de l’équipe marketing, en s’assurant de l’atteinte des objectifs fixés.Assurer une gestion managériale des collaborateurs avec un accompagnement fort, en maintenant un niveau d’exigence élevé.Mettre en place des outils de suivi afin d’optimiser la performance et la qualité des livrables. Stratégie et représentation Marketing :Participer à la définition et la mise en œuvre de la stratégie marketing sur les offres & activités liées aux enjeux paiement des professionnels et des entreprises (massification du virement instantané, refonte des offres de cash management, développement de nouvelles offres d’encaissement, etc)Représenter la direction Marketing lors de certaines instances stratégiques internes et externes (comités, événements, rencontres avec les partenaires, etc.).Garantir la continuité opérationnelle lors de son absence et être un point de contact clé pour les équipes et les partenaires. Gestion de projets & du portefeuille produits :Piloter certains projets marketing à forte valeur ajoutée et/ou complexité, en veillant au respect des délais et des budgets.S’assurer d’une revue continue des portefeuilles produits et de la cohérence des 4P (produit, prix, place, promotion) avec les orientations stratégiques du Groupe.Collaborer avec les différentes entités du Groupe Crédit Agricole pour garantir la cohérence des actions avec les pôles marketing monétique porteurs et distribution et la pertinence des offres Paiements.Contribuer à l’élaboration de nouvelles offres et à l'amélioration continue des processus internes. Analyse et veille du marché des paiements :Assurer une veille active des tendances du marché des paiements, des innovations technologiques, et des évolutions réglementaires en particulier sur les flux.Être force de proposition pour anticiper les besoins des clients et adapter les stratégies marketing en conséquence. Coordination transverse :Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les autres départements (filières, commercial, data, etc.) pour garantir une approche transverse et intégrée du marketing Paiements.Assurer la fluidité de la communication et la synergie entre les différents départements concernés.

Complément

Intégrer CAPS, c'est :

Rejoindre une entreprise dynamique, portée par les innovations technologiques

De multiples opportunités professionnelles

Un plan de formation et de développement adapté à vos besoins

De nombreux services vous facilitant le quotidien

Une politique RSE engagée

Quelques raisons supplémentaires…

Un package de rémunération attractif (primes sur objectifs, intéressement et participation)

De nombreux avantages sociaux (CSE, offre bancaire groupe, remboursement des transports à 90% etc.)

2 jours de télétravail par semaine en moyenne

Notre processus de recrutement comprend deux entretiens (managérial, RH associé à un questionnaire de personnalité), avec la possibilité d’un échange supplémentaire.

Critères de candidature

List 3

Oui

List 2

Cadre

Education Level

Bac + 5 / M2 et plus

Long Text 2

École de commerce, université, ou formation équivalente avec une spécialisation en Marketing, Finance, ou Gestion.

Short Text 1

550 ou 700 selon profilAnglais professionnel

Free Criteria 1

Connaissance des outils et des stratégies marketing dans le domaine des paiements (B2B, B2C) et maîtrise des enjeux digitaux.Une bonne compréhension des enjeux et de la culture d’un grand Groupe et de sa complexité de gouvernance.Leadership naturel, capacité à fédérer et à motiver des équipes, gestion de la pression, forte aptitude à la prise de décision et à la représentation institutionnelle.Rigueur, sens de l’organisation, capacité d’adaptation, proactivité, et sens de la diplomatie.

Free Criteria 2

Pack Office

Entreprise Crédit Agricole Payment Services

Filiale du groupe Crédit Agricole, Crédit Agricole Payment Services, leader des services de paiement en France avec près de 30% de part de marché, conçoit des solutions de paiement destinées aux entités du groupe. Au cœur de la relation client, les paiements font partie des usages quotidiens et évoluent sur un marché dynamique en perpétuelle transformation. Pilote de la stratégie paiement du Groupe, Crédit Agricole Payment Services conçoit le processing des transactions réalisées par les clients des banques du groupe et développe pour eux des offres de services innovantes, conjuguant facilité d'usage, sécurité et répondant aux meilleurs standards du marché. En agissant chaque jour dans l'intérêt de la société, nous sommes un groupe engagé en faveur des diversités et de l'inclusion et plaçons l'humain au cœur de toutes nos transformations. Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.

raw_detailed_info.title: Manager Marketing Offres de paiement et encaissement H/F

enhanced_info.title: Lead Professional, Energy Marketing, Paris/France
enhanced_info.description:
Who You’ll Work With

Nike Energy Marketing drives connections with those that are culturally impacting today’s most discerning youth communities and puts forward new ideas to explore with them the intersections of sports and culture (fashion, music, art, design…).

As part of the Paris Energy team, you will work fluidly across the Paris/France Marketing Team, to foster strong relationships with cultural talents in the city/country. You will also work cross-functionally in the Paris office with key partners such as the Nike Brand Team and Sports Marketing in service of our athletes. You will work closely with the EMEA Energy Marketing Team and the Men’s/Women’s Consumer Construct (Marketing) teams in EHQ.

Who We Are Looking For

We are looking for a talented experienced marketing expert who is extremely well connected with Parisian youth cultural emerging scene and with a strong connection to fashion and a strong network with the community. An inventive marketing talent with an ability to imagine stories that can inspire the next generation to move, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, find new strategic approaches as well as lead end-to-end project and keen to partner with crucial marketplace partners to turn their ideas into a reality on the ground.

A marketing talent willing to move forward in an experimental approach, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, a testing ground to push the limits strategically, incubate, test and learn to imagine and build a new space for Nike and sport, when others do not see the looming opportunity. A collaborator with interest, open-mindedness and limitless passion, translating visionary language into something unique in its modernity.

What You’ll Work On

As the Lead Professional, Energy Marketing Runway, Paris/France, you will be a part of the Paris/France Marketing Team, reporting directly to the Director, Energy Marketing, Paris/France. This role will be responsible for balancing relationship management & marketing execution through our key talent relationships across the Paris cultural ecosystem.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For

Identifying and managing a network of cultural catalysts in Paris to boost the brand priorities and create the future of sport, in alignment to our global strategyProviding exceptional service and brand management to all talent relationshipsCreating visionary marketing concepts aimed at pushing the intersections of sports and culture through creativity with strong resonance among the youth in ParisLeading product collaborations projects with external partners & Global teamsFeeding relevant key catalyst relationships strategically into Geo & Global campaigns work to advance our position within our key sports territories Driving key Energy campaigns through pinnacle marketplace ecosystem in collaboration with our store partnersBriefing and managing external agencies Identify, gather and formulate structured insights about forward-thinking customers to enable us to better serve creative youth on the ground in Paris, and providing feedback to EMEA/Global teams to support long-term concepts 

All roles in our organisation will need to be agile to some extent. This will ensure that in an ever-changing landscape we always have enough resource to ensure pinnacle execution of our most key priorities.

WHAT DO YOU BRING TO NIKE?

A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered.

Essential Requirements

Solid experience in brand and/or brand functional management, with a strong focus on cross-functional marketing.Experience in cultural marketing in Paris and a demonstrable understanding of the visionary and forward-thinking customer, the city and Nike's position within it with credentials in strategic decision-making in this environment.Proven experience identifying, owning and managing external relationships with thought leaders in Paris - with a strong focus on fashion, aligned with Nike's strategic objectivesPrior marketing experience and a demonstrable understanding of the consumer, Paris and Nike’s position within it, with a track record of making strategic marketing decisions within this environment.A background and strong network within fashion and lifestyle is desirable.A desire and willingness to work in an agile fashion as neededProficiency in French and English

The closing date for this position is 1 September 2025. Relocation is not offered for this role.

enhanced_info.title: Marketing Performance & Effectiveness Manager
enhanced_info.description:
Job Description

Marketing Performance & Effectiveness Manager 

Poste basé à Paris 8ème

Contrat: CDI

Statut: cadre

Diageo a été créé en 1997, mais son activité repose sur les principes et les fondations établis des années auparavant par des géants de l'industrie – Arthur Guinness, John Walker, Elizabeth Cumming et bien d'autres. Aujourd'hui, Diageo est le leader mondial des boissons alcoolisées, produisant une collection exceptionnelle de plus de 200 marques et possédant 20 des 100 plus grandes marques de spiritueux au monde. Son portefeuille comprend Talisker, Singleton, Zacapa, Don Julio, Tanqueray et Guinness.

La culture de Diageo est construite par les cinq valeurs qui sous-tendent son activité et guident sa façon de travailler : Chez Diageo, les employés sont passionnés par leur clients et consommateurs et être les meilleurs. Ils se donnent mutuellement la liberté de réussir et se valorisent les uns les autres. Les employés travaillent dur pour être fiers de ce qu’ils font et de la manière dont ils le font.

Notre raison d’être – Célébrer la vie, chaque jour, partout – joue un rôle important dans notre entreprise, pour nos employés, notre diversité et nos marques.

À propos de l’équipe 

Au cours des six dernières années, Diageo a investi dans le développement et le lancement d’une capacité innovante en efficacité marketing, appelée Marketing Catalyst, récompensée par l’IPA en Europe et l’ANA en Amérique du Nord pour son travail pionnier dans ce domaine. Grâce à une suite robuste d’outils dédiés à l’efficacité, l’objectif est de permettre à chaque marketeur de mesurer et d’optimiser la performance de chaque euro investi en marketing.

L’équipe Marketing Effectiveness est un groupe d’experts qui pilote l’agenda de l’efficacité marketing. Basée au cœur de l’organisation Diageo, elle est responsable de la gestion et de l’amélioration de nos livrables, analyses et outils dédiés à l’efficacité marketing.

À propos du poste

Ce poste occupe la fonction de référent fonctionnel en efficacité marketing pour le marché français. En tant que Marketing Performance & Effectiveness Manager, vous définirez et piloterez une feuille de route dédiée à l’efficacité, en collaboration étroite avec les équipes mondiales ainsi que locales. Vous aurez la responsabilité de l’atteinte des objectifs de performance marketing pour la France.

Le rôle inclut également le développement d’un cadre de mesure complet permettant aux équipes marketing et trade marketing de comprendre et d’utiliser efficacement les outils et analyses disponibles, intégrant à la fois les mesures à court terme et à long terme. Vous serez amené(e) à identifier de nouvelles opportunités de mesure et à explorer des méthodologies innovantes afin d’offrir une vision globale et cohérente de la performance marketing.

Pour ce faire vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes marketing, finance et les fonctions trade marketing.

Vos Principales Responsabilités

Assurer l’atteinte des objectifs de performance marketing en optimisant l’utilisation de la plateforme d’efficacité marketing de Diageo sur le budget marketing.Favoriser un changement durable des comportements en intégrant les principes d’efficacité marketing dans chacune des décisions d’investissement.Intégrer pleinement la réflexion et les compétences en efficacité marketing au cœur du business et du cycle de planification.Concevoir un cadre de mesure intégré qui permette aux équipes marketing de déterminer les solutions adaptées à chaque contexte, afin d’adopter une approche harmonisée de la mesure.Entretenir des relations avec les équipes globales (GBTs) et instaurer un cycle d’optimisation en collaboration avec les équipes et les hubs régionaux.Collaborer étroitement avec l’équipe d’efficacité marketing pour synthétiser les résultats et insights clés relatifs à la performance marketing, et veiller à leur communication efficace auprès des décideurs.Gérer et faire évoluer en continu le programme d’analytique marketing qui soutient la capacité d’efficacité marketing.Rechercher de manière proactive et continue des pistes d’amélioration pour renforcer la capacité d’efficacité marketing de Diageo, afin de maximiser la création de valeur.

Votre Profil

Minimum 6 ans d’expérience en efficacité marketing, acquise dans l’univers des biens de grande consommation et/ou au sein de cabinets spécialisés en efficacité marketing, d’agences de modélisation économétrique ou de cabinets de conseil en stratégie.Expérience avérée dans la conduite du changement.Excellentes capacités d’influence.Capacité à transformer les insights en actions concrètes et impactantes.Excellentes compétences en communication, à l’oral comme à l’écrit.Autonome, proactif(ve) et à l’aise dans un environnement en constante évolution.Habitué(e) à collaborer avec des interlocuteurs variés, dans différents pays, et à construire des relations solides.Maîtrise courante du français et de l’anglais.

Célébrer notre culture inclusive et diversifiée est au cœur de l’objectif de Diageo de « célébrer la vie chaque jour et partout ». Cet objectif est, en soi, de nature inclusive, car il valorise chacun sans distinction d’origine, de handicap, de religion, d’identité de genre, de sexualité ou d’appartenance ethnique.

Nous savons que pour que notre entreprise prospère et que Diageo réalise son ambition, nous avons besoin de talents diverses avec une gamme d'expériences, de compétences et de capacités dans chacun des 180 pays dans lesquels nous opérons et pour refléter notre large base de clients. Nous considérons la diversité comme l’un des principaux facteurs qui contribuent à la croissance de notre entreprise et nos valeurs, notre objectif et nos normes établissent les conditions nous permettant de respecter la contribution exceptionnelle de chaque personne.

La flexibilité est la clé du succès dans notre entreprise et bon nombre de nos employés travaillent de manière flexible de différentes manières, notamment à temps partiel ou à horaires condensés. Parlez-nous de ce que la flexibilité signifie pour vous et ne laissez rien vous empêcher de postuler

description.text:
Job Description

Marketing Performance & Effectiveness Manager 

Poste basé à Paris 8ème

Contrat: CDI

Statut: cadre

Diageo a été créé en 1997, mais son activité repose sur les principes et les fondations établis des années auparavant par des géants de l'industrie – Arthur Guinness, John Walker, Elizabeth Cumming et bien d'autres. Aujourd'hui, Diageo est le leader mondial des boissons alcoolisées, produisant une collection exceptionnelle de plus de 200 marques et possédant 20 des 100 plus grandes marques de spiritueux au monde. Son portefeuille comprend Talisker, Singleton, Zacapa, Don Julio, Tanqueray et Guinness.

La culture de Diageo est construite par les cinq valeurs qui sous-tendent son activité et guident sa façon de travailler : Chez Diageo, les employés sont passionnés par leur clients et consommateurs et être les meilleurs. Ils se donnent mutuellement la liberté de réussir et se valorisent les uns les autres. Les employés travaillent dur pour être fiers de ce qu’ils font et de la manière dont ils le font.

Notre raison d’être – Célébrer la vie, chaque jour, partout – joue un rôle important dans notre entreprise, pour nos employés, notre diversité et nos marques.

À propos de l’équipe 

Au cours des six dernières années, Diageo a investi dans le développement et le lancement d’une capacité innovante en efficacité marketing, appelée Marketing Catalyst, récompensée par l’IPA en Europe et l’ANA en Amérique du Nord pour son travail pionnier dans ce domaine. Grâce à une suite robuste d’outils dédiés à l’efficacité, l’objectif est de permettre à chaque marketeur de mesurer et d’optimiser la performance de chaque euro investi en marketing.

L’équipe Marketing Effectiveness est un groupe d’experts qui pilote l’agenda de l’efficacité marketing. Basée au cœur de l’organisation Diageo, elle est responsable de la gestion et de l’amélioration de nos livrables, analyses et outils dédiés à l’efficacité marketing.

À propos du poste

Ce poste occupe la fonction de référent fonctionnel en efficacité marketing pour le marché français. En tant que Marketing Performance & Effectiveness Manager, vous définirez et piloterez une feuille de route dédiée à l’efficacité, en collaboration étroite avec les équipes mondiales ainsi que locales. Vous aurez la responsabilité de l’atteinte des objectifs de performance marketing pour la France.

Le rôle inclut également le développement d’un cadre de mesure complet permettant aux équipes marketing et trade marketing de comprendre et d’utiliser efficacement les outils et analyses disponibles, intégrant à la fois les mesures à court terme et à long terme. Vous serez amené(e) à identifier de nouvelles opportunités de mesure et à explorer des méthodologies innovantes afin d’offrir une vision globale et cohérente de la performance marketing.

Pour ce faire vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes marketing, finance et les fonctions trade marketing.

Vos Principales Responsabilités

Assurer l’atteinte des objectifs de performance marketing en optimisant l’utilisation de la plateforme d’efficacité marketing de Diageo sur le budget marketing.Favoriser un changement durable des comportements en intégrant les principes d’efficacité marketing dans chacune des décisions d’investissement.Intégrer pleinement la réflexion et les compétences en efficacité marketing au cœur du business et du cycle de planification.Concevoir un cadre de mesure intégré qui permette aux équipes marketing de déterminer les solutions adaptées à chaque contexte, afin d’adopter une approche harmonisée de la mesure.Entretenir des relations avec les équipes globales (GBTs) et instaurer un cycle d’optimisation en collaboration avec les équipes et les hubs régionaux.Collaborer étroitement avec l’équipe d’efficacité marketing pour synthétiser les résultats et insights clés relatifs à la performance marketing, et veiller à leur communication efficace auprès des décideurs.Gérer et faire évoluer en continu le programme d’analytique marketing qui soutient la capacité d’efficacité marketing.Rechercher de manière proactive et continue des pistes d’amélioration pour renforcer la capacité d’efficacité marketing de Diageo, afin de maximiser la création de valeur.

Votre Profil

Minimum 6 ans d’expérience en efficacité marketing, acquise dans l’univers des biens de grande consommation et/ou au sein de cabinets spécialisés en efficacité marketing, d’agences de modélisation économétrique ou de cabinets de conseil en stratégie.Expérience avérée dans la conduite du changement.Excellentes capacités d’influence.Capacité à transformer les insights en actions concrètes et impactantes.Excellentes compétences en communication, à l’oral comme à l’écrit.Autonome, proactif(ve) et à l’aise dans un environnement en constante évolution.Habitué(e) à collaborer avec des interlocuteurs variés, dans différents pays, et à construire des relations solides.Maîtrise courante du français et de l’anglais.

Cet objectif est, en soi, de nature inclusive, car il valorise chacun sans distinction d’origine, de handicap, de religion, d’identité de genre, de sexualité ou d’appartenance ethnique.

Nous savons que pour que notre entreprise prospère et que Diageo réalise son ambition, nous avons besoin de talents diverses avec une gamme d'expériences, de compétences et de capacités dans chacun des 180 pays dans lesquels nous opérons et pour refléter notre large base de clients. enhanced_info.title: Head of Sales, Europe West & South
enhanced_info.description:
We do things differently around here.

We built ClearBank on the belief that banking infrastructure would no longer slow down progress. Instead, it would be a catalyst that unlocks the potential to innovate. It would adapt to different needs so a new era in financial services could begin. We’re here to challenge the status quo in banking, are you?

We all know that transforming banking forever is not an easy mission, but we’re more than ready to rise to that challenge. We all do it every day; navigating new, unexpected and sometimes even daunting challenges. But we believe in ourselves and trust we can do it.

Want to innovate? Go for it. Push for a better way? You Can. If you think you have it in you, this is Where You Can.

What You Can Expect

ClearBank is a place where you can do things differently and challenge the status quo. We will give you a high level of autonomy and transparency, and we trust you to make the right decisions for the bank.

If that excites you, how about joining our European Sales team as a Head of Sales, Europe West & South? Reporting to EU Chief Executive Officer and Group Chief Revenue Officer, you will focus on creating sustainable revenue growth, supported by top-grade sales execution.

This is initially a fully remote position, but we are specifically seeking someone based in France to help us build strong local foundations and serve as cornerstone for our future growth in the market.

You will be responsible for developing and executing the Europe West & South (France, Italy, Spain, Portugal, and Mediterranean countries) sales strategy to achieve revenue targets and other key performance indicators (KPIs). Additionally, you will be directly responsible for originating sustainable new business opportunities and client prospects for ClearBank Europe, and achieving new client logo wins and revenue growth.

This role involves close collaboration with the CEO and the senior management team of ClearBank Europe, as well as the Group Chief Revenue Officer, to drive sales and success across your region. You will apply a leadership-level of expertise to the planning, creation and execution of growth and sales strategies. Decisions made will have a very high impact on the image, success and growth of ClearBank Europe.

In This Position You Will

Devise and gain senior management approval for a sales plan, to include targets and KPIs, which drives the growth of ClearBank Europe in Europe West & South – positioning the company as a long-term business partner to potential clients, challenging the status quo and creating momentum for change.Implement the approved sales plan to achieve short, medium and long-term revenue growth, as well as other KPIs.Take the lead in sales campaigns and owning the end-to-end sales cycle – marshalling internal resources, driving consensus for change and negotiating client contracts to achieve business objectives and to maximize revenues.Embed and manage world-class processes to provide a solid platform to support the growth of the company in Europe West & South – particularly to include sales processes (forecasting, pipeline management, territory management, account planning etc.).Play a lead role in developing senior-level contacts on a multi-stakeholder basis in major clients, potential clients and partners to drive market traction.Develop and manage the partner ecosystem to enhance ClearBank Europe’s sales effectiveness in Europe West & South.Recommend pricing and sales strategies to the leadership team in order to maximise long-term value.Contribute to the overall leadership of ClearBank Europe, working closely with cross-functional teams to support management of existing clients and to provide market feedback and input into the development pipeline of new products and services.After initial success in building sales pipeline and winning new client contracts and as required by the business: build, develop, coach and lead a top-class Europe West & South sales team capable of driving the business forward, providing strong leadership and creating a positive and high-performing team culture.

What You’ll Bring

To excel in this role, you’ll also need:

B2B sales and client management experience in the Banking or Fintech sectors: You have extensive experience in successfully selling and managing high-value complex solutions to clients on a multi-stakeholder basis and over long sales cycles.Sales strategy: You have experience of developing commercial strategies and plans to achieve revenue goals and KPIs.International experience: Preferably you have extensive international experience gained elsewhere in EuropeLanguage skills: Excellent English and French skills. Fluency in another European language (such as Portuguese, Italian or Spanish languages) is a plus.Proactive attitude and leadership mentality: A proactive approach to sales and achieving targets; a pioneering spirit; takes the lead and uses initiative. An inclusive and collaborative approach; a team player who engages with and brings the wider team together; consults and listens; engages constructively.Energy and Dynamism: A creative and dynamic self-starter; action-oriented; enthusiastic with a positive approach.Drive and Ambition: Motivated to succeed, meet targets, and exceed them; driven by making a difference and challenging the status quo.Resourcefulness and flexibility: Utilizes the wider team’s skills to maximize sales growth for the whole business; able to work autonomously and create momentum; prioritizes effectively while remaining focused on target and the highest value deliverables; thrives in a fast-changing environment and performs under pressure while remaining calm; creative and not afraid to innovate. Commercially focused, market-oriented, and data-driven in driving business; leverages network for commercial gain.Personal Qualities: Organized; reliable; trustworthy; high-integrity; detail-oriented; resilient; determined; open; transparent; calm.

Regretfully we are not able to sponsor applicants for immigration purposes at the current time.

A little bit more about us!

ClearBank Is Where You Can Belong

At ClearBank we think about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DE&I) a lot. Not because we think we should. But because we know we should – how else can we build a happy workforce and be successful as a business. We’re committed to making sure our teams reflect society. And we put energy and effort into making this a place where everyone feels at home, where they’re given the trust and encouragement to do their very best work. Here are some of the things we’re most proud of:

42% of our senior management roles are held by women Our enhanced family leave policiesLaunching our partnership with Code First Girls Increasing awareness of neurodiversity in the workplace through our partnership with the Inclusive Group 

Our Hiring Process And What You Can Expect

Application: a member of our talent acquisition team will review your application against the key requirements for the role and let you know within two weeks whether you’re moving forward to the next stage;

Screening: You’ll spend 30-45 minutes speaking to one of our recruiters learning more about the role and ClearBank, and we’ll get it know more about you, your experience and how your skills align with the role (this will be via phone or Teams video call). You can expect to hear back from us within seven days following this meeting (if things are taking longer than expected, we’ll let you know that too);

First Interview: You’ll spend one hour with a member of our hiring team focusing on your skills, competencies and your ways of working at the same time we’ll give you time to ask more questions about the role, the team and learn more about the ClearBank culture. This will be via Teams.

Second Interview: This will be a competency-based interview with one or more members of our team.

Final Stage: You will have a final meeting with the Head of Department. This will be around 45-60 minutes.

Offer: Congratulations! Get ready to transform banking forever!

Our Commitment To You As a Candidate

We will always try our best to get back to you within seven days of your interview whether you’ve been successful or not and provide you with feedback. Sometimes things take a little longer, so we may not have a decision to share but we will get it touch to let you know we need a little more time.

We’re unable to provide specific individual feedback at the application or screening stage but know that your application was reviewed and considered carefully.

We wish you the best of luck with your application and maybe we’ll be celebrating your new role at ClearBank soon!

Equal Opportunities

ClearBank is committed to ensuring equal opportunities throughout every stage of the recruitment process. ClearBank recognises that diversity is vital to the long-term success of the business in the communities and markets in which it operates. ClearBank is also a firm believer that an inclusive culture fosters greater employee engagement and collaboration.

ClearBank strives for diversity and inclusion of all forms, including (but not limited to): gender, age, educational and professional background, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief and sexual orientation.

As part of the Company’s commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable adjustments, to candidates during the recruitment process, including to individuals with disabilities. We want to create a safe space that welcomes everyone so please let us know how we can accommodate you. In case you have any accessibility requirements you can share that with our Talent Acquisition team prior to your interview stage, if applicable.

The legal bit

By submitting your CV to ClearBank Limited you are providing your consent for us to use the information you provide for recruitment purposes. For more information on how we manage your data go and check out our Candidate Privacy Notice on the ClearBank website to see how we process, manage and look after your data. You are also allowing us to communicate with you by email and telephone for recruitment purposes.
